description:
Good food, average experience. We would like to say a big THANK YOU to Jeannie for going above and beyond for our dining experience. And a, thanks for not giving a crap about us, to Jackie who was about to be off her shift and didn't care about us as her table. 
Forgot our waters, forgot our appetizer, I asked for soup, couldn't substitute, asked for a salad, she forgot to put in a side salad. Basically just did the minimal since she knew she wasn't going to be getting the tip. 
Luckily her relief actually cared about us, (aka Jeannie) and we were taken care of for the rest of our visit. 
On another note, food was fantastic and you get some amazing views of the bay and Alcatraz when you have a prime spot in the dining room. I highly recommend the fresh fish and the creme brûlée sampler! 
5 stars for Jeannie, 1 star for Jackie!
author: Alison R.

description:
As I searched around Pier 39 on a beautiful and extremely busy Saturday night, I discovered that every place had a long night. I thought I hit the jackpot since I walked right in and sat at the bar, but I should have taken that as a sign. 

The view here is stunning and, in my opinion, the best on the Pier, but that's how they get you. I ordered a drink and a water from my sever, about 10 minutes later, I got a very watered down raspberry limoncello martini, no water. The drink had no taste and was a poor excuse for a martini. 

While I was there, the bar was about half full, but as soon as I got my drink, I never saw the bartender again until 20 minutes later. Don't get me wrong, he was busy, but on the other end of the bar. 

When I finally got the bartenders attention, he got my bill and left me to sign and tip with a dead pen. I tried to track him down, but just wanted to get out of there, so I searched my purse, signed the bill and left. 

I sat at the bar bored and reading their reviews and they were very comparable to my experience. When service isn't good, you don't want to invest any more money into a place. I honestly wanted food, but was scared I would be there until midnight.
author: Emily D.

description:
Whoa, what a view of the pier!  

Fine dining with nice ambiance.  Solid American entrees with refined drinks! 

One is here ideally for the panoramic view over driving! 

Sports' bar tv available for watching or one can admire the view instead!
author: Tiffany D.

description: We had lunch here today. I had the BBQ Bacon Burger with sweet potato fries and my brother had the Fish and Chips. They were both delicious. The service was great and the menu is moderately priced especially considering the bigger portion sizes. They also have a great wine selection and amazing views of the Bay and Alcatraz!
author: John L.

description:
I'm literally in awe to see that Chart House only has 300 something reviews & 3 stars because I thoroughly enjoyed dining here. My group and I came to Pier 39 on 4th of July and after searching around for what seemed like forever for a restaurant to eat at, we ventured here and were pleased to be seated within half an hour even though they said the wait would be closer to an hour. 

I was feeling like seafood since I figured it would be the specialty so I went with the fresh Mahi which came with sides of potatoes & vegetables. The fish was so incredibly fresh and I liked the creaminess of the sauce. In addition to the Mahi Mahi, I knew I had to get the clam chowder since that's the 'touristy' thing to do while in San Francisco. I enjoyed the feeling of being able to munch on clams that seemed fresh out of the ocean. 

We got very lucky and had the best seats in the house for fireworks. We basically ate and indulged for 3 hours until the fireworks came on and were able to enjoy the show indoors while people outside the restaurant on the pier appeared to be freezing to death! (Poor poor people).

I would definitely recommend requesting to sit by the window. The sunset view really is breathtakingly romantic and I couldn't stop staring at it and taking deep sighs. 

I have high hopes for this place and believe it deserves a much higher average rating!
author: Monica C.

description:
This ambiance of course is what you are paying for you when you come to places like this.  It's the last place in the back of this boardwalk, upstairs, and secluded.  When you walk in you are immediately greeted. That is a big deal for me; Even when your busy you should try to greet your guests.  There was immediate seating at the bar and about a 10 minute wait for the tables (most likely you would have a window seat right by the water) on a Saturday afternoon around 6:30pm.  So we sat at the bar.  It took them a while to greet us there.  Understandable..no biggie it's the bar.  A waiter came by, greeted us, dropped off the napkins, after that we didn't see him for about 15 min.  They got our order and it wasn't delivered to the bar then to us which I like. The kitchen brought it straight to us. 

Now the portion sizes are small like we were in Europe or something. That's why I say you are paying for the ambiance for sure. The main fish was good and a good size but the potatoes that came with it ..like 6 pieces and they aren't the same size and the side asparagus...2 pieces.  I was kind of upset at that because I live asparagus.  I got a side of creamer spinach and that was the "best thang runnin".  Out of all our food choices (the fried fish platter ..lobster Mac and clam chowder and my ahi blackened the creamed spinach was the bomb lol.  

Overall I had a good experience.  They love breaking glasses there.  The manager and the bartender / barback broke a glass within the 1.5 hours we were there.  The check for just my food and bae's was $111.00 (blackened ahi and fried platter).   The Mac and clam chowder bowl was about $50. 

The other places around the pier was poppin' and to get more for your money I would definitely go somewhere else.  It if you want the atmosphere then go here.
author: Toni S.

description: We had an amazing night today. We were glad we did not wait for our spot at Bubba Gump (1hr wait). Catch House is a better choice. With the Amazing view and a romantic place for a quiet dinner date this just made our day. We started with the Bruschetta for our appetizer. Everything was delicious. The spreads were so flavorful, the jam, cheese, mushrooms, artichokes, hummus, crab and bell peppers. Its a great starter. We shared the Orange Scented Fall Salad. Such a refreshing salad with beets, squash, pecans and a lot of good stuffs in there. Not overly dressed. I wanted to get the seafood cioppino but  im too lazy to eat and crack the crab so i decided to get the seafood pasta. The scallops and fish were great as well as the sauce but i was hoping for a larger shrimp. The shrimp were pretty tough but it still taste good. My boyfriend got the seafood platter with coconut shrimp, fish and calamari. What can go wrong with deep fried seafood and 3 dipping sauces. It had the Perfect crunch that we wanted for a fried food lolz. Servings are generous and both of us were satisfied with what we had. We enjoyed watching the Pelicans, Seagulls, Sea Lions and a lot of charter boats plus the view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Alcatraz. Service were good too. We were lucky to be seated in a spot were we can see the nice view of the water. It was a wonderful sunset dinner. Bathrooms were clean too. That is a plus. We are planning to come back and try other food on their menu. Reservations are recommened but walk-ins are welcome. Highly recommended when you visit Pier 39 (Fishermans Wharf).
author: Kristina A.

description:
Great sea views alongside harbor, great services, not too bad price (a bit higher than other restaurants in that area) for finding crowded pier 39 relaxing. 
The services also great, caring customers for every detail but not disruptive. The most important, all staff keeping their smile when they served. 
I like their fired fries, thin and chewy, a smoked smell also fitted in the flavor! Besides, I was satisfied with the clam chowder soup. The bread was a little sour and fresh, had a great combination with the soup.
author: Yun S.

description:
I came here today and had a overall good experience. I ordered the lemon herb crusted salmon which I can't deny was delicious. The service was also fairly quickly since I came with a party of 6. 

The reason I'm giving it a 3/5 stars is because for such prices I was sad to see such dirty silverware. My moms glass was dirty enough for us to ask for another one and the appetizer plates looked greasy and dirty. 

I can't deny the food was good like I said, but the tableware was dirty and for 50$ steak plate I would like to have seen clean silverware at least.
author: Aliya T.

description: That restaurant is amazing!!! I had an amazing dishes. I had Garlic bread as an appetizer and it was so hard to explain how yummy that was! I had lobster bisque cup lemon herb crusty salmon and Chilean sea bass. I can't wait to go there again. Only thing is serving is a bit slow that was all an it was okay for me.
author: Alp O.

description: Came here for my birthday they did not have any reservations available they told me the first opening was at 8 p.m. so I had to wait an hour and a half but the manager came out at 10 minutes after we sat and waited she seated us which was so awesome of her! Our server was Anthony he is so amazing the most happiest friendly is knowledgeable waiter I have ever encountered. Food was amazing we got seated right by the window with the view which is super special cuz that's what I wanted for my birthday,dinner with the view. This place is really good for a nice romantic dinner with a view or a date night. Good food, great service, no to expensive.Overall AMAZING!
author: Michele T.

description:
Great view. Food was good, service was just ok. Group of 10 of us. Entrees came out slowly a few at a time. One person did not get their entree until almost 10 minutes after the rest of us (4 people ordered the same thing, 1 of the 4 came 10 minutes later.)
View is great, even with fluctuations in the fog.
author: Reese R.

description:
I would honestly say this is the most beautiful decor of a restaurant on the Pier with some of the best views. 

We sat at the bar as we were only stopping in for a drink. Upon sitting down we were treated with prompt service and tasty, beautiful beverages. However, that is where the great service stopped. We ordered another drink and glass of water. Got the drink....the water arrived about 30 minutes later as we were paying our check. 

For this type of restaurant even though the product was good...the service was lacking  

Would I give them another chance...sure if I were looking for a higher end meal on the Pier.
author: Brigid D.

description:
It's a lovely restaurant with nice views.  

Unfortunately, it took forever and a day for our food to come out which was puzzling because there was hardly anyone in the restaurant.

The lobster bisque was amazingly good and the clam chowder was pretty decent as well.

Our table had the crab melt which was disappointing. A lot of brown crab meat.  No thanks.  The fries were cold.

I had the chicken BLT which I found very good, despite it being on the cold side as well.  My friend had the chicken Francesca which was Parmesan crusted chicken  with pasta which she enjoyed.  They used the same chicken on the BLT.

Our waiter was very nice and attentive.
author: Nicole L.

description: My partner and I went to the Chart House for a late lunch.  We ordered several drinks, appetizers, and lunch.  The front house manager (older blonde woman) was a total B*TCH.  The service was horrible, and the food was mediocre.  It's clear that many of the restaurants in the downtown and wharf area don't care about providing good service and good food to the tourists who visit San Francisco.  Next time I'm in the city, I will avoid Wharf restaurants like the plague!
author: Shawn B.

description:
Don't let the beautiful landscape surrounding this building manipulate you. The service is absolutely horrible, there's large posts blocking your view (depending on where you sit) and the staff is very unapologetic for a n y t h i n g. 

My boyfriend and I came for a great meal. The layout of the building and interior is exquisite, and the view looks awesome while you are waiting to be seated. Our wait time was forty five minutes and we requested to be texted when our table was ready. We ended up staying in the building the whole time waiting for our seats. My phone lit up with a text letting us know our table was ready but when we walked up to the host she informed us it would be ready in "2 seconds" but it took nearly ten minutes. I went to the bathroom and my boyfriend had ended up getting seated, he asked the waiter if he could go tell me where we were seated. The waiter then stated that he had to stay put because they had other people to seat. Implying our table would not be made available to us if we were not present. Which is crap because we had waited over an hour for our seats in the first place. I made my way to the table and we finally were ready to place our order. Our server took more than five minutes to greet us for drinks. He finally arrived and while he was talking to us, he for some reason took our silverware and napkins (??) which was odd but I figured he just wasn't paying attention. Bread was brought out to us but it was cold and the included crackers were stale. There was also a hair in our butter. When reported to the waiter he looked more annoyed versus apologetic and never brought out an additional butter even though he said he would. The food looked AWESOME, but wasn't that great. Especially for how expensive it was. The crab melt was pretty good and came out hot. The fries on the other hand were definitely not their specialty, which is safe to assume considering they're mainly seafood based (being by the ocean and all). The coconut shrimp was kind of dry, but decent, but the fried fish tasted kind of weird. The calamari was great and the "famous lava cake" was aight. I was expecting some amazing dessert since it was so called ~famous~ but it was actually dry and literally burnt. I've had better desserts at the Cheesecake Factory for better prices. 

All in all, the place wasn't to great and not really worth as much as they charge. I would consider it more of a one time thing since the view is beautiful depending on your angle, and some of the food items can be quite tasty. The service, however, is a completely different story. And hopefully you won't get a hair in your butter, yikes !
author: Ar T.

description:
This is the best restaurant at pier 39! First of all, I have only ever came here with reservations made and have never waited to be seated, so take note. 

The view is amazing and definitely gives diners a fantastic San Francisco experience in one meal so it's a great place to take tourists and visitors. 

Food is standard Chart House - lobster bisque is excellent and meaty! My favorite thing on the lunch menu is the spinach chopped salad, it is great! The parm sourdough garlic bread is also fantastic.
author: Anne C.

description:
We are from the bay area, and just went to fisherman's wharf to have a fun play day with family. 

We loved chart house when we went to Las Vegas, the one that's located at the Golden Nugget.

The crab was meaty and fresh, with large juicy chunks, fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, sliced egg, it was absolutely delicious.

You would think at fisherman's wharf that you would be able to get an awesome crab Louie, even better than in a place like Las Vegas. 

This one sucked. In fact all of our food was mediocre at best. 

The crab was like tiny bits of shredded leftovers and the veggies were chopped into small morsels. I suspect because it wasn't fresh because it did not taste fresh. Weirdest thing was the egg. Yolk all crumbled up on top of the salad. 

We also had a French dip which had over cooked meat and very thick bread. 

The best thing at our table was the kids fish n chips.

They have a fantastic bar though. 

I guess if you're located at fisherman's wharf you're guaranteed to have customers even if the food sucks.
author: Coree C.

description: Beautiful place for spending your day. You can enjoy the view of ocean. Friendly service, good food. A big selection of wine. My order was a steak with grill vegetables. Everything was good. The manager personally came to see how we are doing. Definitely come back again !!!!
author: Jack R.

description:
The view was absolutely gorgeous. We could see Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, and sea lions, and all the tourists below jostling for positions to see that same view. 

The food was good, buttery. The bread came out warm. I had the chicken, with capers and very soft mashed potatoes, and the drinks were very tasty. 

We had to wait an hour for the food. We were a group of almost twenty for a birthday party, but we did send in our order in advance. The wait was a bit much.
author: Renee D.

description:
We stopped in for drinks and an appetizer yesterday afternoon. Sitting at the edge of the bar we ordered and then waited a while (not a big deal). When the bartender came back she made sure to tell us that we ordered "the two most complicated things on the menu". "Okay" I said, "sorry about that but we will make sure to take care of you guys."

More time passed and our drinks came (not very good) and then our food (also not good) The food was a plate with vegetables and cheese and hummus and jam and like 4 little pieces of bread. We ran out of bread about halfway through, and asked for more bread and also what this one mystery dip on our plate was. The bartender disappeared for 20 minutes and never came back. We just wanted to get out of there at this point so I put cash on the table and left. (Way too much because I didn't have change so they still got a good tip after all of their effort to ruin our afternoon).

Look, I get that some things on the menu are more of a pain in the ass to prepare than others, and that you can make comments to that effect, but if you comment and then basically promise (and absolutely deliver) bad service because of that?  Just really rude.  I would never spend a dime in the Shart House again and will actively recommend that people not go there when they are in the area. So many better options. Yuck. What a bad experience.
author: Nicholas B.

description: The food was not that great.  The best part of the meal was complimentary sour dough garlic bread.  That was delicious.  Service was also good when it came to the server we had, but it took an extremely long time to get a drink.  The view of the bay was nice.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Chart House is located right in Pier 39. We visited Chart House as a group and were quoted a wait time of around two hours or so. While, they did appear to be busy, I believe that they over estimated the amount of time that it would take to accommodate our group because by the time that we were leaving, the place had emptied out a great deal. A member of our party suggested eating at the bar. We sat in the eating area and the bar tender took our orders and served us from there.  We would have done this initially, had the option been given by either one of the two hostesses. It saved our party a great deal of time and was a simple solution to a group of people traveling  in from the East Coast, that very same day, on business.

I ordered the crab melt on rye. It was served cold, though it should have been warm. That greatly impacted my overall experience, though I do imagine that straight from the kitchen, it would have been phenomenal. It is an open faced sandwich. The fries were also luke warm. 

Our party enjoyed their food, but nobody really seemed over enthusiastic about their meals. Overall okay, but I might venture down the road to check out Fisherman's Warf or somewhere similar.
author: Kari C.

description: Loved this place! The food was excellent and the decor was very nice. Not to mention the view! I can't believe this place had 3 stars! The only slight complaint I have is the  hostess was so so barely smiled, acted like she didn't want to be there. Other than that top notch. Get the garlic cheese bread it's to die for!
author: Sherry G.

description:
Worst service I've ever experienced. I'd tip a McDonald's server more after this.

Plenty of staff around, yet nobody even makes eye contact with me for 20 minutes...then they want an order right now, only after we stole the menus from the table next to us. 

Once the food comes, it's okay...but we never saw the waiter again and had to go to the bar to beg for a check. Atrocious.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
We came here on a Sunday date night for the views and Chart House definitely delivered. It was sunset and absolutely stunning. We started off with free bread and butter, as with most fancy restaurants. Our mains were the Prime Rib French Dip with Monterey Jack, caramelized onions & au jus ($19) and the Dungeness Crab Melt with tomatoes, Jack & cheddar cheese served atop toasted Boudin sourdough ($19.5). The prime rib was very juicy and the au jus a great addition. The crab was surprisingly an open-face sandwich, with so much cheese that it was almost overpowering the crab flavor. They were both good, but definitely not worth their prices. However, I get the "ambience" tax that we were paying and understand why they were so high.

This was a unique experience, mostly thanks to the view and unparalleled service. The food was okay - nothing spectacular and a bit overpriced. I would definitely come back, if only to bring visitors just to check out the view. It's a tourist trap for all the right reasons.
author: Jenny D.

description: Incredible location, great views, decent food, absent service. Had planned on full dinner, left after one round of drinks and some poorly executed appies. Whoever has been doing the hiring there should be doing something else, something that doesn't involve hiring people.
author: Dave F.

description: The food was amazing! Started with an Ahi tuna appetizer, it was delicious.  For my main course I ordered the  Mahi grilled with an avocado/tomato topping.  Also, had the best Peach Sangria.  Must try!
author: Mary R.

description: This place has nice views,  a well designed interior,  but lacks in service and quality of food.  We're ordered the clam chowder and the crab melt.  We waited about half an hour for our food,  which came out cold.  The bread bowl felt like it come out of a refrigerator,  the fries were room temp at best,  and the sandwich was also cool.  The food tasted alright,  but we had better chowder on the pier yesterday.  I would recommend going somewhere else.
author: Peter G.

description:
Have been here 3 times and each time I walk away saying it's my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. 
We had the Crab Louie and the Mango Stack followed by the Lobster Soup all to die for. Service was great and we had an awesome view. All that is missing is the Sea Lions aren't on the docks today perhaps they are out feeding. But try this place just love coming here!
author: Kathy J.

description:
On our last morning in the city we wanted to walk around the Pier then go get some lovely brunch.

I couldn't resist coming to dine at the Chart House.  I don't know if they're affiliated with the location in Monterey but I love that restaurant and I knew it would be good coming in to dine at this location.

My cocktail of choice was the Strawberry Bubbles.  I couldn't have ordered a more perfect brunch cocktail.

The seat we were sat at had a view of the tour boats coming in and out of the pier.  It was really fun to watch people sail by on a boat.  The view was very awesome.

Crab Melt was my choice of dish.  A Crab Melt is something I cant ignore when its on a menu.  Its a fairly decent sized sandwich. It was more than enough crab but a little too much bread for me.  

My man had the burger.  I would probably order that the next time I came in too.  It looked fantastic.  He didn't share so I cant tell you exactly how good it was.

If you're looking for brunch on a random morning in SF.  Come by here.  Its a beautiful place to come in for a little morning bubbly and good seafood. Or burger, which ever you prefer.
author: Ivy R.

description: Appetizers came out quickly and server was great!! The main course was delicious and everything came out hot and well presented!! Definitely recommend this place
author: Joseph D.

description: Photos of the sea gull feathers. Absolutely insane.
author: John M.

description:
Our neighbor took me and my girlfriend out here to catch up after our overseas trip. We ordered cocktails and the shrimp/crab appetizer. The cocktails didn't come until after the main prime rib because they were "backed up". The restaurant was pretty empty. The food was average. 
The next day we all woke up at 5am with horrible stomach issues that remained the rest of the day. To pay over $200 for 3 people, have a poor dining experience, and sick on your Saturday is unacceptable.
author: Connor O.

description: Where do I start? There are so many wrong things about this place. The only good thing is the view. The food was horrible,extra salty, over done. The food took forever to come out and the place was pretty empty. The service was  so bad. The girl took for ever to come around, my order was wrong, I got over charged. I don't understand the place was empty. I will definitely not ever come back to this place. Don't waste your time and money.
author: Ruby P.

description:
We came in at 12:40pm on a Saturday, the restaurant was about 40% full, and we sat right down. 

We didn't have anyone check in on us with even water for 15mins, then the order taken 15mins later. 

At this point, the kids and us were well hungry and we had to ask for bread 4 different times to get some.

The food took over an hour to come and was eatable but not great. 

The manager apologized, took something off the bill and we left. 

Only served water once during the entire 1hr and 25mins seating. 

Nice view, great potential but clear they have organization challenges. 

Everyone seemed frazzled but oddly, there appeared to be plenty of staff. 

I feel bad for the manager, it seemed everyone intended well, but they need to regroup and turn it around.
author: Dave E.

description:
All the San Francisco walking always makes me hungry! After an adventurous morning with my sister and a fun tour of the aquarium we were on the hunt for a mini meal to tide us over till our evening dinner reservations. 

I picked Chart House for it's happy hour menu. From 4-6pm they have $6-$9 small plates and a $6-$8 drink menu. The place was pretty empty so we had our choice of bar seating. We could've sat in the more scenic part by the windows and scene of the bay, sitting by the entrance offered a bit of peace and quiet. My sister was debating her cocktail choices while I was more interested in the food, deciding on two small plates instead of one. I got a glass of chardonnay ($6) and she got the raspberry lemon drop ($8). For food she got the fish and chips on happy hour ($7) and I got the Coconut Shrimp ($7) and the Oyster Rockefeller ($9) both on happy hour as well.

Everything came beautifully presented. The portions were perfect for a mini meal. I tried a bite of her fish and it was so good I almost placed an order for a second one (dinner reservations prevented me....next time I'll get my own!) The oysters were served on a bed of blue rock salt, very pretty (what do they do with the garnish after though? I wonder...) and my sister loved the homemade tarter sauce. The coconut shrimp she actually loved despite her dislike of coconut- it wasn't a sweet coconut she declared, it was definitely more "nutty" and not oily at all. My wine was good but now I wish I had gotten a cocktail like she did, especially during happy hour. 

Looking over their dinner menu they have a $30 chef's tasting which is always fun to try, I would love to go back for that. The rest of the items seemed pretty standard in this fancy, right on the river restaurant in the most touristy part of town. You should expect that when you walk in BUT if you are looking for an affordable bite with great ambiance and AMAZING customer service you have to come during happy hour and sample a few small plates here. Matt, our bartender was so on point- friendly, helpful, amazing customer service and a great drink. Kudos to Matt!

Thanks again, we will be back soon.
author: Evangelina R.

description:
Hubby and I celebrated our 14th Anniversary here.  Staff went the extra mile to make our dinner truly special and memorable.  I'm happy there's finally a Chart House in SF, and it makes sense they took over Neptune's...about time!  Ironically, we found out the news about Chart House SF from the Lake Tahoe location when we were there October 2015, good times!
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=1W9xlmmmo966kB2Od6q-ew

Many moons ago, I was told there was a Chart House in Sausalito...imagine the views.  Well, the one in SF is just as amazing, along with stunning views of Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, boats and cruise ships sailing by.  It sure makes for a romantic night out, and the icing on the cake was seeing the Hornblower SF Belle sail by our window.  Many unforgettable memories on the SF Belle, as we renewed our vows on that spectacular yacht.  

Onto the food, we started out with the shellfish skillet (highly recommended).  I brought a bottle of wine for the special occasion ($25 corkage).  Although, they have an extensive wine list and pretty reasonable by the bottle.  Hubby ordered swordfish for the first time, and it was superb!  He enjoyed his entree; our server Gerardo mentioned it was an excellent choice.  I ordered the seafood pasta, and it was full of creamy flavor, not cheesy or salty, absolutely delicious.  When the Manager of the Day Amanda came by our table, I had cleaned my plate.
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=HqyTA3O8CyOtLUrUvAIu4Q
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=BLhF5UvJmdEEzc7-3bqjFQ
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=dL5dGEIxM-17Li-AHsBKHg

Of course no anniversary celebration is complete without a decadent dessert.  We ordered their signature hot chocolate lava cake with molten center, made with Godiva liqueur, topped with chocolate sauce, heath bar crunch, and vanilla ice cream - must have!  It takes at least 25 minutes to make per our server, and what made it even more special was Amanda taking it off our bill...did you think I was going to say the candle HA!  https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=tG6PayvjXsf_udkqP8CsVw

Thank you for making our anniversary unforgettable!  Can't wait to come back, even just for happy hour and the views alone.  'Til we meet again ~ cheers! https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chart-house-san-francisco?select=T9j67ueo6VERQcw7WI-Faw 

P.S.  I couldn't get Eric Clapton's song outta my head...oh my darling, you were wonderful tonight.  Hubby calls me his darling every night (makes me feel all giddy).  The key to a successful marriage is laughter and never go to bed angry. =)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vUSzL2leaFM
author: Christine R.

description:
My husband I got married at San Francisco City Hall August 14, 2017. We were looking for a nice place close to the water to have a reception dinner with our family. Since our wedding was simple I wanted dinner to be special. We had a small party of 14 and were to small for most places that also charged a huge minimum.
 
I was so happy to find Chart House and Stanley R. Howard, Catering Sales Manager. He helped me design a set menu for the adults and kids. He was even able to print them with our names and date. We were set up with an elegant table in a semi-private room, that felt so private. We had a beautiful view of the bay, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. We were also close to the sea lions which was perfect for the kids.

The food was amazing. We had Clam chowder, salad, salmon, filet mignon and chicken picatta. The kids had burgers, fish & chips and chicken strips. The deserts were decadently delicious and the drinks were great. All of the staff was so friendly and helpful. Everyone went above and beyond to make everything perfect. I can not thank them enough for helping make our special day extra special.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Do I need to give this place even one star? Two plus hours for lunch for a party of 8. Food came out cold. Excuse given was the kitchen staff were under staffed. Manager came by and apologized saying they would comp the dessert. It took 30 minutes to get cold desserts out! 
The only thing beautiful about this restaurant is the view of the bay and Alcatraz.
author: Pat W.

description: My husband and I had lunch at the Chart House in July 2018. We were there early so we had a window seat with a bay view. We ordered the shrimp crab stack, seafood cobb salad and maple salmon. All of which were excellent. The bartender and our server Ciara were very good and attentive. We love this place.
author: Retired M.

description:
I have reviewed a Chart House restaurant Atlantic City and eaten in the one in Weehawken.  I've given Landry's gift cards too.  I knew just what to expect when we went to the Chart House on the end of Pier 39 in San Francisco.  Okay I really hadn't a clue.

We requested a table for four with a view and we were seated against the window with a million dollar view of the bay.  The sun glare that was in our eyes when we were seated turned into a beautiful sunset as it set behind the Golden Gate Bridge. We enjoyed our cocktails and the manager stopped by and welcomed us.
  
I had the seafood pasta which is described on the menu as "scallops, shrimp & fresh fish in a light garlic cream sauce over fettuccine." What I got was fish scraps with no identifiable scallops, with dry rubbery shrimp in sauce over some wide egg noodle.  I was so disappointed. My sister-in-laws Paneed Chicken was also dried out.  

On the other hand, they did a fantastic job on her husband's pan fried Chilean Sea Bass and my wife's Coconut Crunchy Shrimp.  I guess 2 out 4 isn't bad but I set the bar a little higher at Chart House.
author: Rich C.

description:
FOOD:
Overall i would give a decent score for all things tried there after number of visits, likely recommend is crunchy coconut shrimp and blackened chicken pasta. 

DRINKS: Recommend wine of your like and for cocktails, Mango Martini would be your best bet.


SERVICE: 
This can be much better, tables are open sometimes and they still make you wait for couple of minutes. Entrance, you may miss it assuming its closed.

Try going before sun goes down to enjoy the view and request table for view.
author: Mayur C.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place. Direct view of Alcatraz from our table and the sunset.. WOW!!! Very nice ambiance and wonderful food. My dungeness crab was amazing and my hubby's steak delicious. Price was actually very reasonable for what we ordered and we both had drinks. We will repeat for sure!
author: Roxy S.

description:
This was by far the worst dining experience I have ever had. Honestly you could do better at Applebees, TGI Friday or anything value chain restaurant. We had reservations for a group of 12 days in advance and they were not prepared. Starting with the over 45 mins to get our drinks, to members of our party getting their own water pitchers, to some of the meals prepared incorrectly to how they handled the final bills, the entire experience was an utter disaster and big disappointment. The manager offered to re work some bills after we already received them and we opted to just pay as we honestly could not leave fast enough.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d10065601-r611146030-Chart_House-San_Francisco_California.html#
author: JP B.

description: Literally have never written a yelp review but couldn't help but warn future victims of this poor excuse for a dining experience. McDonald's fish sandwich is more edible.
author: Maggie M.

description:
I had high expectations for this place, but you're basically paying for a view of the Alcatraz.
Appetizers: coconut prawns= delicious and loved the tempura bowl it came in.
Clam chowder: had a weird spice that I could not make out... it didn't taste right... almost like anise...
Spinach salad was great!
Dinner: bronzed swordfish with Dungeness crab= sword fish was tough and over cooked and the crab tasted like it had been frozen for a while... flavorless and not sweet like one would expect from a restaurant on the pier. 
Fingerling potatoes had good seasoning. And I almost laughed at the 2 asparagus stalks... it was grilled and charred! But really...2?
Dessert: Lava cake awesome! Topped with ice cream and toffy nut chunks. 
For the price, I expected dinner to be in point but it wasn't. 
Stick to Fog Harbor if you want good food all the time.
author: Rose Jane B.

description:
Had lunch at the Chart House today. The food was good. Started with shrimp cocktail and then had the seafood Cobb salad. This review is less about the food and more about the service....SLOW!!

When we arrived about noon, the restaurant was almost empty but we were told it would be a 10 minute wait and we could enjoy a drink at the bar. You & I both know, this was not because they were busy but because they wanted to up the bill total with some cocktails. Fine, I like a good cocktail and would have ordered one anyway. 

The waiter was painfully slow. Took forever to take our order and then an eternity to get the food. I actually aged while waiting. When the food finally came, my salad was missing dressing so the waiter had to go back and get it. I honestly think he had to go to the 1000 islands to get the dressing (see what I did there? 1000 island dressing-haha-I kill me)

Once we were done eating we had to wait a long time for the check. We didn't let him leave the table without paying him right then as we may never see him again. 

If you are not in a hurry...have no where else to be...and have notified your family that you will be out of touch for a while, go to the Chart House-the food is actually good.
author: David S.

description: Dinner was fantastic. The food and drinks were great, and the view was amazing. What made the dinner was our waiter, Carey. He was awesome and made everything perfect.
author: Bob S.

description: Extremely disappointed. I didn't look at the reviews due to my past 2 experiences here and WOW do I regret not reading the reviews before I came in. We had a party of 4 and the wait was 30 min so we decided to sit at the bar which went from ok to allllll bad. The recent reviews were on lack of customer service and food. I can definitely speak on the lack of customer service and follow up. We waited 15 minutes to be recognized by the bartender who finally took our drink order and we waited another 10 minutes for our drinks. We were ready to place our food order and the bartender said she would be back, guess what? She never came back! I went to go back to the hostess to say the service is slow and we were ready to order and the response was rude so we ended up leaving.
author: Frank V.

description:
Tuesday night and service was incredibly slow and my party was on a time crunch. Food took really long and even our drinks took about 25-30 minutes to come out. They got my order wrong, but we were in such a rush and I was so hungry I was like screw it I'll eat it. Ok now that I got that out of the way, regardless of the slow service and messing up my order I understand and appreciate our server for his patience and helping us out.

Lobster Bisque - Yes get it!

Coconut Crunchy Shrimp - Cooked well with the perfect amount of crunch. Coconut flavor not too strong, just the way I like it.

Seafood Pasta - I actually ordered the Seafood Platter but it got mixed up. This was alright, it was good just not something I was craving. At least there was a generous amount of seafood in it.

Enjoy your food with a lovely view of the water!
author: Geoffrey C.

description: Great service and attention. Kindest staff. Manager stopped over twice to make sure our dinner and travel was very exceptional. Dairy allergy was attended to carefully. Will return! The food was outstanding. It was perfect.
author: D J.

description: Hostess is so rude and unprofessional. We will be talking with management.  Too busy talking with bartender for 10 min while we waited at hostess station!! Ya we got there a little early for our res time but this was inexcusable behavior from a service industry employee. I'm sure the restaurant would have lived to have our $300+ bill on a thurs. Worst experience at chart house ever. We're regulars at Monterey, Tahoe kingsbury, Oahu, LB, and have never had this experience. Hostess was a straight up snatch! Reservation? Yes, oh well we're slammed so you'll have to make other arrangements. I walked into dining room and saw at least 5 empty tables and we were the only people there. We left and got a really nice dinner at one of the other nice restaurants on the pier WITHOUT A RESERVATION AND WERE SEATED IMMEDIATELY!!!
author: Floyd G.

description:
We tried the salmon and were floored. Succulent and buttery. Simply couldn't have been prepared any better. Silky and flaky. 

The staff were all terrific and we never waited too long at any time during our visit. Raj managed to seat us in a relatively short time during peak activity despite us not having a reservation. Alison blazed a trail helping my wife order around food allergies and was cheerful and prompt. 

Highly recommended.
author: Lance T.

description:
I made reservations online and they had our table ready within minutes of entering The Chart House.

Someone different than who would turn out to be our waiter asked for our drink order, to never return.

They did bring two waters.

They provide bread for the table, which is similar in style to the bread from Outback.
I ordered the prime rib, which came with garlic mashed potatoes and added a bowl of soup.
My date ordered a Chicken dish of sorts, but the waiter returned to our table to let her know that they had ran out of chicken.

I had asked our waiter what happened to the drinks,since it had been 20 minutes, was hot out,and I was dying for a Coke. He said that they were having issue with the blender  (for the alcoholic drink that my girl had ordered). 

The drinks would finally make their way out, but I wasn't really bothered by it due to the gorgeous sunset that we were witnessing from our ocean view table.

The food would come some time later, maybe 30-45 minutes, but what do you expect on the busiest night of the week. You should know that walking in.

The prime rib was delicious, and I am very picky when it comes to prime rib.
The soup, also delicious. Best "award winning clam chowder" (aren't they all award winners no matter where you go) that you can find on Pier 39.
The garlic mashed potatoes also delicious.

Our tab was just over 100, which isn't too bad,in my opinion for all of the food we had, coupled with the great service. Our waiter's name was "Nick" on the bill, and if that is actually the waiter and not the guy who took the drinks, then he was very pleasant and professional. We have gone here more than a few times and although I prefer the older gentleman waiter (who looks like Gorilla Monsoon's slimmer twin brother) , but Nick was also equally great.
author: Mike M.

description:
I can see why the reviews here are so low. I guess if it's not obvious, this place is likely only surviving because it's in the at the end of the pier, in one of the most touristy areas of San Francisco.

I only came here to enjoy the view and a beer but the food on other people's tables looked decent.

Like lots of folks are saying on Yelp, the service here is terrible. I sat near the bar with my fiancé where some angry-looking server who had to be told by the bartender to serve us. She had some attitude and no smile--maybe due to having a bad day or hating her job. Either way, bad service seems like a trend at Chart House given multiple similar testimonies on here. There was another guy who served us who actually understood what customer service is. Because of that dude and the unbeatable view, I'll leave this place with 3 stars.

Come for some food or drink but don't expect to be treated well.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Came here with a group of 10 coworkers. Great location and excellent view. 

Ordered the Spiced Ahi on top of Furikake Rice, wasabi cream and ginger soy. It was described as a light sear on the edges but for mine, it was slightly more cooked. It was still pretty good though. 

Some of us were a bit nervous to bring our Irish colleagues, considering the 3 star average review, but our service was great. They even got to meet fellow Irish folk working for the summer. Our server was attentive and did well from initial drinks to desserts.

Overall, I thought this place was great. I had a great view of the coast, the sea lions and Alcatraz. The sunset at around 830 pm was beautiful. I can see this place to be good for a date, families and even a group of coworkers!
author: Nhilven D.

description: Great seafood, staff are very accommodating and service was superb! This is our favorite go to spot to watch the Warriors road games.
author: True R.

description: At the VERY end of pier 39, you come to Chart House. Beautiful views of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge. We ordered the prime rib, lobster Mac n' cheese, and the creamed spinach. Medium rare cut was just perfect! The Yukon mashed potatoes were delicious. Mac n cheese was mouth watering!! Loved the bread crumbs on top of the cream spinach! Great food and service with amazing views.
author: V Elise W.

description: The waiting I experienced was short and the service was great.  However, the food was good but not great.  They did allow us to order steak which was gracious but they didn't season it much.  The dining area is nice and surrounded by cool views of the Bay Area.  Overall, a good place to eat but don't expect to be amazed.
author: Eduardo C.

description:
We visited this restaurant with some friends from out of town on Sep. 20th. 
We arrived at the restaurant at 12:30 pm for lunch and were told we had to wait approx. 20 minutes for a table. This surprised us since we could only see about 4 tables occupied and many tables empty.  While waiting for the table we approached the bar and ordered some drinks. Drinks were brought to our sitting area in the lobby in an unprofessional way for such type of restaurant: bartender and a server both carried our drinks on their hands without any kind of tray or platter. And then the bill for the drinks was totally out of hand.
We stayed for lunch anyway to enjoy the nice view from the table. Food was below standard and  nobody in our group was really satisfied with their orders. We received the bill which was totally overpriced for the overall service and quality of food we were served. 
I have to admit that our server was very pleasant and took her time in explaining the different food options, kudos to her.
Needless to say, we won't be back to this restaurant in the future and we won't recommend to anybody.
author: Gonzalo Q.

description: Delicious food and friendly staff/servers! Also has a beautiful view of the ocean. Definitely recommend!
author: Nicole S.

description: This was an awful restaurant. My water was dirty and so was the replacement wAter, the spoons we found had hardened left over clam chowder on it, the pasta tasted like it was seasoned with candle wax, our food took 2 hours before it arrived and our server didn't check on us once.
author: Rawan M.

description: A late lunch about 3 pm.   We had the coconut shrimp, salmon, and peanut sauce Mahi.  All three were excellent.  The view by the window was great.  A relaxing lunch , service was excellent with good conversation with waitress.  Don't mind paying for a good meal, great service and an excellent view of the bay.
author: L P.

description: I was very pleased with the Crab Melt. Only thing I'd change would be, instead of making it on a thin sourdough slice of bread (which became very soggy) It would be even better if made on sourdough garlic bread. We waited a few minutes when we walked in without anyone acknowledging us, I was ready to walk out.
author: Veronica H.

description: Worst Chart House I have ever visited. They need to get new management and staff as this one will bring down the name and quality reputation of all the others. Should rebrand it so it's not a Chart House. The other Chart Houses are very good. Food was not good, service was absolutely terrible, presentation and place was run down. Very bad for a Chart House.
author: George D.

description: Lunch at Chart House!   We hadn't been to Pier 39 in awhile--I think Chart House used to be Neptune's Palace.  Even without a reservation, we were seated in a short time.  The interior seemed much nicer than before, and the food is great!  I had an incredible Crab Louie Salad...and you can't go wrong with bread from Boudin's!  Every table in the house has a great view of the Bay.  The staff was very courteous and professional.  Brandy was our server--very personable, attentive, and funny!  We'll definitely be stopping at Chart House again!
author: Mike W.

description:
This place has a gorgeous view of the bay - the food is decent though. My group of 11 stumbled upon this place after sailing the bay - being a large group, we opted to just stay around the bar area and have drinks. We also ordered a bunch of appetizers since it was Happy Hour... they have a good selection of discounted food from 4-6 on weekdays. I'm not sure about coming here otherwise... it's pretty expensive and it's not like the food is amazing.

- Mediterranean Hummus Tasting ($6): Colorful, but the hummus wasn't anything special. Best part was the plantain chips they give... these are good on their own. Really wish they'd provide more bread for the amount of hummus that comes with a plate!

- Prime Rib Sliders ($9): These were BOMB. Seriously, the prime rib is really tasty and goes great with the onions. Each order comes with 3 and we ended up getting more of them. Comes with the same sauce you get with french dip.

- Kim Chee Calamari ($8): Not sure how I feel about these... they're perfectly fried and the calamari is delicious... but in the 2 orders we go, we got more fried vegetables than we did calamari. Felt kinda ripped off. The fries vegetables were pretty tasty, especially with the sauce.

- Salt and Pepper Chicken ($7): Pass. The chicken was really dry and bland... dipped in the sauce it was OK. Fair warning, the sauce is pretty spicy.

- Ahi Nachos ($8): These were OK... the wasabi drizzle overloads your sense of the taste. I think the calamari is a better deal if we want to talk about portions too. Honestly the ahi tuna you can get at a poke place for a better deal and quality.

- Spinach Artichoke Dip ($6): Good with a beer! I really wish they'd give you more crostini, since there isn't enough for the amount of artichoke dip there is. Like the hummus, they're so stingy on carbs here haha.

- Coconut Crunchy Shrimp ($7): Pass... these are alright, but so small for the portion and price. 

Service is pretty hilarious here... at least at the bar. While we were waiting forever to get drink orders (it wasn't even that busy), they lost a couple's order of appetizers and they also misplaced a guy's credit card. Ouch. They also forgot our ahi nachos during the first round of food, but luckily they recovered on the second round. I'd say it's a decent place if you come during Happy Hour - the view is really nice.
author: Alyanna C.

description: I would not recommended this place because the foods were too salty. My boyfriend ordered filet mignon, the meat was chewy and salty but the mash potato was good. I order beef sandwich which was a big mistake because the bread was hard and the beef was too salty. The chef at this location love to put extra salt in every disks. It is not worthy to come.
author: Kelly H.

description:
My friends and I stopped by the Chart House on a Tuesday evening in cold, windy February, and were seated next to the window with corner view of the sunset plus Alcatraz/Angel Island. The maitre de came by to welcome us at 6pm, and the place was quiet. Our waiter, Allen was very attentive, gracious and served us warmly. Wonderfully kind hospitality. The decor was of a quiet elegance, clean lines, with an Asian flair, more sophisticated than most of the Pier 39 restaurants, with wide space between tables for easy conversational sound level.

I had the Chef Tasting Menu at $30 fixed price, starting with an ample, covered vessel of excellent clam chowder, followed by Shrimp Fresca - five large, delicious, butterflied parmesan encrusted shrimp over a flavorful, moist fettuccini with pomodoro sauce (fresh chopped tomatoes) and finished with a salted caramel creme brulee, most enjoyable. One friend tried the filet mignon, cooked medium, and said it was tender, with a delicious peppercorn sauce. Another had a minimal appetite, but enjoyed the clam chowder and a chopped spinach salad. 

This is the place to welcome out of town friends, and give them good memories of our beautiful city.
author: Carolyn D.

description: We had a wonderful view with excellent service. The food was good, not great, with the exception of the lobster bisque...it was delicious.
author: Stephanie W.

description: We only sat in the bar by the window with an awesome view of Alcatraz, the bay and great people watching. I had the raspberry lemon drop martini, it's awesome!!! The bartender was attentive and very nice.
author: Kim W.

description:
Ok, expensive, yes. Not quite sure why they are averaging less than 3, but the price may have something to do it.

We had steaks, whole crab, garlic bread, and desserts. The steaks were all individually prepared perfectly, and my Goddaughter enjoyed her crab. I paid for the crab butter added to my filet mignon, but it didn't do it for me....the steak was better without it.

The letdown....dessert. We got a few to share. The key lime pie was...gritty. Not a word I want associated with dessert. They seemed more presentation then perfection, so seemingly a waste. 

I would definitely return for dinner, but forgo the dessert
author: Dan W.

description: Outstanding! Last minute decision to eat lunch here this afternoon without a rez. Welcomed and seated within 10 minutes with a fabulous view of the bay and Alcatraz. Enjoyed the Dungeness crab melt, the barbecue bacon burger on a pretzel bun and a prime rib french dip. Crab melt was a perfect blend of seasonings and cheese on a delicious slice of sourdough. French dip didn't have an ounce of fat on it, was tender and was also on an amazing roll. Cheeseburger on pretzel bun was perfect. We followed all this with the chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream and heath bar crumbles. THIS was outstanding and I've Hoovered down a lot of lava cakes across the country. Perfect molten center with the crisp brownie-like exterior. Our server was polite, professional & attentive. This was such a welcome surprise after the Alioto nightmare of Tuesday night. Thanks Chart House!
author: Renee L.

description: What a joke. While sitting in the lounge with wife and kids on an empty mothers day, went to order a couple drinks. Waited almost 20 min at the bar just to order a drink, walked away, gave up reservation. Seriously, if it takes that long to not order a cocktail, I can only imagine what the food service would be like. No wonder the place was empty on such a normally busy day.
author: Nico M.

description: Well it's definitely a nice view, wine and ambitious that was superb. But sorry to say food not that great. Well the shrimp appetizer was pretty cool. Was with a group of friends and we pretty much all agreed it was just ok. Not horrible, definitely wouldn't recommend
author: Michelle S.

description: It's a nice environment with a great view and it's so sad that was wasted by having this place here. We had a free couch e but actually didn't eat much since everything was so bad. And as others have noted the staff is super slow. But yeah, wish we picked another place for our vouchers because this was the worst meal I've had in the city. If I had spent money here I would be so upset.
author: Ms. P.

description:
The Chart House - not this branch - holds a fond place in my heart, hearkening back to its 1970's era heyday as a classy date night place.  They were on the water (Chart House is always on the water), sported a menu painted onto a wooden plank, and had a salad bar for which there was little match.  It'd been years since I'd stepped foot inside a Chart House and was surprised to see this one sitting out there at the far end of Pier 39.

Though most things do change over the course of 40 years it took a bit of sleuthing to discover what I believe is the biggest reason for changes to the Chart House:  In 2002 the franchise was bought up by Landry's, an organization which owns and operates more than 500 restaurants, hotels, and casinos including Joe's Crab Shack, Rainforest Cafe, Bubba Gump Shrimp Company, Claim Jumper, and a whole lot more.  

Just reading that list saddens me as I associate it with a sort of institutionalized mediocrity.  

Amid the hubbub of Pier 39 I think it'd be difficult to maintain a restaurant which I'd today describe as classy and I don't think Chart House is trying too hard to do so.  The place looked anything but special, and just like every other place on that list above.  

Many people coming for a drink and a snack, as I was, will probably head to the tables immediately on view upon entry but the smart money is to wade inside a bit.  There are water view tables in the bar area from which the ambiance is improved.  

Drinks (2 Irish Coffees, 2 Keoki Coffees) ran around $10 apiece and were unremarkable as was a steamed Artichoke appetizer.  A Mediterranean platter was an odd mix which included plantain chips and something hummus-like which was trying to masquerade as guacamole.  None of it was bad, but that's not to say it was good.  The whole experience (aside from good service) was just terribly mediocre.  

Like that long ago love you run into many years later, Chart House hasn't weathered well at all under Landry's watch.  It's gone from something special to nothing special.  If you want a drink and a water view and insist it be at Pier 39 this is probably about the best you can do but if you're willing and able to move off this pier and head southeast, you can do far better.
author: Tracey A.

description:
We came here on the hunt for a nice place with a view and clam chowder. After waking around a bit we just ended up here. It was 3pm on a Thursday, but not too busy. We initially asked for a table along the window to get a great view and the hostess let us know that they are mainly reservation only. Ok nbd since you could see the view from most of the tables. 

I wish I knew the hostess's name because she was awesome! She got us a table along the window in the corner with a fantastic view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz 

My fiancé ordered clam chowder and lobster mac n cheese and I got the seafood platter bc I couldn't decide what I wanted. The calamari was delicious, light and fresh like it should be. The coconut shrimp flavor was ok, pretty coconutty, yet slightly deceiving bc it looks like you're getting 6 pieces, but in actuality it was only a couple pieces split in half to the tail so it looks like it's 2, but it's not haha. Now the fish...I known their fried fish was going to taste the way it did, I wouldn't have ordered it. I got through half of the first piece before I took off all the breading of the other half and the second piece.  I couldn't even tell which was the gross part, the breading or the fish itself. I made myself eat the fish with tartar sauce on it bc I just couldn't let it go to waste when it was $29...

The three stars is for my fiancé enjoying all of his food, the awesome view and great service. If you want fish and chips though, you might be better off at any one of the million other venders and you'd have leftover cash for some Ghirdelli
author: Jealee A.

description:
I decided to wait two weeks before writing this review, because I was not happy and did not want my rage to affect the fairness of a review. I also read most of the reviews on Yelp, to make sure my case wasn't just a fluke. Conclusion: this place needs to change, fast.

Here we are, visiting from Miami, on a road trip from Phoenix to SFO, and my daughter wants a to have lunch at a nice restaurant on the water. Chart House looked ideal, although prices are high, but if food is good and service is top notch then pricing is a non issue. 

We arrived early, at about noon, place was 80% empty, so we ask for a table by the window. Hostess, which never smiled once and demonstrated that customers are not really that important, said that unfortunately there were no window tables available, but we would get one that had a good view too. We got a table in the second row, the view was good if the window table had no one sitting there, which was not the case, but whatever. To my surprise I looked around and saw a couple of empty tables by the window, I wondered if they didn't have enough staff to serve that area, because why would she deny us the table we requested if there are available? Lo and behold, 15 minutes later they take a couple to the empty window table. Really? I was not happy. 

After about 10 minutes our waiter (finally)  arrives. He's ok, all business, seemed to be in a hurry, although place still was half empty. Didn't care to discuss items on the menu.

Anyway, since we are in CA, we both decided to order the Dungeness Melt ($20 each) and the Cup of Clam Chowder ($5).

Drinks took forever to arrive, so did the food. I was thinking "please don't bring me cold food, please don't ruin it".

Crash and burn, the Melt was melted for sure, but 20 minutes ago, now it was solid, and lukewarm. Plate was cold. And the Clam Chowder (appetizer) came almost at the same time as main dishes. To make things worse the Melts and Chowder were just OK, nothing worth the price they charge.

Then we want to get our check. Waiter missing in action. Took like 20 minutes to get the check and pay.

Here's just an aside to the attitude of the waiter: the check had a 5% "surcharge", when I asked what this surcharge is he responded in great disdain "it's to help us with our health insurance deductibles"... really? They can't afford the ACA (oxymoron  intended) and we have to pay for it? This elevated my anger even more, since his service was sub-par, and now I have to help him pay his insurance.

In summary, a $75 lunch bill for two average-tasting sandwiches, one mini clam chowder and one beer (Bud Light at $7.50!!), and unremarkable service, grumpy hostess, and taxes and surcharges.

Sorry, I can't recommend this place, not even for tourists.
author: Alexandre H.

description:
We had the opportunity to entertain customers and decided on the Chart House on the Pier since some of our guests where first time visitors to San Francisco. 

Our first night there was great.  Our waiter was on top of things. there were 11 of us at this event.  Focused on Good times, Food, and Business.  

We arrived just before sundown, and of course we were able to see the bay, which is an amazing site from this establishment on the pier.  The food was wonderful, what made out first night there memorable was the staff.  Our waiter was on top of it.  Very attentive, paid attention to multiple tables, but you could not tell, he was that good. The food was wonderful, no one was thirsty, and our table was always kept clean.  This was a 5 star experience... 

The second night this time with only 9 of us, and a less crowded evening that the first, our waiter was lacking.  While the food was good, our table was cluttered, our water glasses were empty, and when we ordered refills on drinks through out the meal, we waited a long time.  For example, we asked for coffee, or night caps to close the meal, but received them after the bill came... awkward ..  we had to remind our waiter that we ordered the drinks.  But we felt, the second night we were taken for granted.  This was a 2 star night.  Our guests even felt the lack of attention... 

overall, the experiences were inconsistent. I can see why some give this place 5 stars and other only give it 1.  I hope they eventually find their grove.  This place has awesome views, the food was good, but what makes or breaks an establishment is the service.
author: Balinor I.

description:
If I can give a negative star I would. It took me over 10 minutes to even get a bottle of water. With no glasses. 25mins to get what is supposed to be calamari but was just a bunch of fried onions, green beans and peppers. 30mins later our food came. My fish tacos had two tiny Mini fish McNuggets in them. My wife's seafood dish was cold where most of the muscles were DOA and unopened.. so just a decoration I guess. My daughters crab sandwich was completely cold as it must have been sitting around for our other food. 

Stay away from this place. The view is the bait, but don't let yourself get sucked in.  Complete tourist trap.
author: Andre L.

description:
The view here is absolutely breathtaking as you can see the entire bay, as well as see the historic Alcatraz right in front of your eyes. The view itself is well worth the cost. 

As for the food, the Kim chee calamari is what all battered calamari aspire to be. The batter was coated wonderfully onto the jumbo sized calamari rings and legs which was generously lathered with sweet and sour sauce. Every bite that I took was a bite that I wanted to take back, because I knew which each bite, there would be less calamari to consume. Basically what I'm saying is, get the calamari its 5 star. 

Other than the calamari, we got a crab cake melt ($19) which had chunks of fresh SF bay dungeness in it, so it was very pleasing, and was topped off with basic fries 8/10

We also got the sea bass ($35), which was a very forgettable dish so it was average at best. 

Although the food was delightful, the service on the other hand is a work in progress. For an establishment as beautiful as this one they should have a staff in which compliments the restaurant as a whole. Unfortunately our waitress came to our table twice out of the hour that we were there, once to take our order and twice to give us the check. It's just unfortunate to have the food and ambience of the place to be over the top while the service is sub par.
author: James L.

description:
Had lunch here on 10/17.   While the view is indeed amazing, the food was at best average in my wife's opinion & sub-par in my opinion.  The service was exceptionally slow & I would not recommend as a lunch option.   My wife had the bread bowl of clam chowder and felt it was nothing special.  I did note the bowl did not even appear to be full.   My wife did give the sourdough bread high marks.   I had the chicken BLT with fries.  I did not even finish half of the sandwich and at 300lbs that's pretty rare .  I felt the grilled chicken had a fish taste to it and the fries were cold and tasted as if they had been sitting around for some time.   My daughter had a burger and fries and indicated the burger was tasty though sloppy (get plenty of napkins) and she also found the fries cold & unappealing.   

Service was polite but reporting as slow and aloof is being kind.  There was no real inquiry into how we felt about our meal and obviously watching us not eat and to refuse carry out boxes for such large portions should have prompted some question into our satisfaction.  Of course I could have asked to speak to management; but, honestly I was frustrated, hungry & running out of patience with my time there.
author: Donald A.

description: Horrible service OMG! Ordered lobster bisque, got clam chowder, asked for fresh bread, didn't get it and had to ask for it again and was looked at like I was an idiot! I paid $4.35 for a soda and the waiter was never around so I could never get it refilled once.. I can't believe what an awful experience it was! Expected a lot more from a higher class restaurant!
author: Nicole B.

description: I was overcharged for a glass of wine!!
author: Amy H.

description:
While the view is spectacular, the food menu and service are pretty weak. In the days of old, Chart House was an excellent place to dine in service and food choices.
Now they are no where close to the Eighties and Nineties.
They used to have some of the best Steak and Lobster around, now they have nether. 
They used to have a Blue Cheese Dressing that was to die for, but it's not on the menu.
They do have a Blue Cheese that is not the same though.
Now, onto the service. The server that waited on us was very nice, but they were very confused about the succession of thing, and he trying to train someone as well. Everything was late or we were just left alone, so we patiently waited. Very poor service.
We will not return to this particular Chart House, the Menu needs a major  upgrade.
author: jim h.

description: The food was amazing. The service not so much. Our waiter was training a girl and she was more helpful than him. He would always walk past our table and when I asked for more water he looked and me and walked away. The girl felt bad and said I'm so sorry I'll get it for you
author: Abby S.

description:
I know to expect a wait on a Saturday in San Francisco, but GEEZ! We were told an hour to wait - it was an hour, that part was fine. But the service was DETRIMENTALLY SLOW!!! And there weren't even THAT many people seated in the restaurant!

Don't get me wrong, the food is great and the servers DO have a great attitude, but my god, the time management needs a giant step up. I won't be coming back unless I have hours to kill. I have NEVER had a lunch that took two and a half hours, more than that if you include the hour wait time.

Don't come here unless you have money to spend (expect to spend $40 per person at the very least) and time to kill, that is if you don't mind being BORED and HUNGRY while you wait for your food to arrive!
author: Jenn D.

description:
We arrived for an afternoon snack and cocktail after a North Beach brunch.. local besties playing tourist on a Sunday funday! 
The views are amazing, the food is great and service was perfect!
The above and Amanda (dining room manager) is the reason we will return next week for brunch.
Thank you for a great experience!

SF locals
author: James T.

description:
Omg. You need to try this place. Honestly after reading all the reviews I was really hesitate and was about to leave the restaurant since I was at the bar area. All the 1&2 stars definitely scared me off but my boyfriend convinced me to give this place a chance. Let's just say I was not in a good mood cause I was complaining that this is gonna suck , etc. 

Started off with drinks - I forgot what I ordered but it has peach schnapps in it and melon too. My first sip I was in heaven . It was soooooooo good. You can taste the alcohol but at the same time I would drink this everyday . My bf got wine and he said it was good too. So that was a positive note. 

For appetizers, we got the shellfish iron skillet. Definitely worth it. Came with some crab, shrimp, and mussel . Whatever sauce they had on it was amazing. Very flavorful and my bf who HATES shrimp , (like will not eat anything with shrimp) gave it a try and loved it . That's saying something haha. 

For our entree my bf got the chart House Cut while I got the prime rib melt. His was medium rare and they made it perfect. I'm not really the type to eat meat rare just because I have a sensitive stomach but I did give it a try. It was so juicy and tender I actually loved it . As for my prime rib melt that was amazing too. Everything from the caramel iced onion to the sourdough bread at the bottom-- it was on point. I was full but couldn't stop stuffing myself. And the mash potatoes !!! 

Unfortunately we didn't have room for dessert but I have a new favorite restaurant at Pier 39 now !! I'm so glad that my bf convinced me to try this place or else I would have been missing out ! I highly recommend this place  if you're in the area!
author: Christine P.

description: Beautiful view. Great food and service. Coconut shrimp was delicious. Filet mignon cooked perfectly.
author: Gordon V.

description: Great views. Table service was relatively slow (took a while to order food and drinks) and food took quite a while to arrive. Waiters were very pleasant and kind. The food was very well presented however taste was average.
author: Daniel L.

description: View is amazing. Food is edible. Service is very slow.  Basically any Landry's Restaurant you have ever been in.
author: Russ J.

description:
Poor management. I understand that things are busy at times but if I'm not seeing a little hustle or at least some effort to show that you are apologetic that we've been waiting for upwards of 30min for any service; then you do NOT deserve anyone's business. Do yourself a favor and take the 15min drive for better food, drinks, prices AND service. I mean... since you will be waiting 30+min to order anyway ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Btw there were many servers and at least 2 managers standing around chilling while this all went on. (Servers wear black button ups and aprons and food runners/bussers wear white; so dont think I'm getting the staff confused)
author: Kiana Z.

description:
Went here with a group of 4 people at around 9pm. I actually like how they did reservation time slots instead of just giving an estimated time.

The food: Absolutely amazing. I ordered the prime rib Captain Cut (14oz) and it filled me up. I was debating getting a bigger cut but the captain cut was a perfect size for me considering I eat huge meal portions usually. The prime rib tasted like a smooth herb butter infused tender steak, one of the best I have ever tasted. I tried a small bit of the seafood pasta, it was also extremely flavorful and smooth. 

The service was the only reason why I deducted 2 stars. I saw our waiter attend to tables right next to us while he simply ignored us. He failed to fill up our waters on multiple occasions without us asking. The only thing he was quick about was giving us our checks. I had to walk up to a server to get a steak knife since they failed to give me one and our waiter never checked up on us. Not sure why the service was bad, but we are just a couple of 18 year olds eating at a fancy restaurant, maybe they just think we didn't belong there, which is also a bad image. 

Value: I would rather pay for my meal and just take it to go, the price is worth it simply for the food!
author: Christian M.

description: We went here on a Monday evening for dinner I ordered the cioppino which was pretty tasty,  my daughter ordered the baked salmon dish which was also very tasty.  My son ordered the crab entree,  nothing crazy it was steamed dipped in butter.  Lastly,  my fiancé ordered the prime rib and it was horrible!  It was dry,  over cooked and it looked old.  The gentle man that serves us was nice, and very attentive.  Even though it took a long time for them to bring out drinks out it wasn't the waiter fault it was the bar workers,  didn't seem like they had their shit together.  Would I give this restaurant another shot.  A BiG maybe.
author: Mary L.

description: On our first night in San Fran we wanted to get seafood while exploring the Piers and decided to go here. The best part about this place was the amazing view we had for sunset, other than that this place is easily forgettable. Our waiter was friendly, but it was his first night and you could tell he was nervous but still very nice. The lobster bisque was great, while I also had the crab & melted cheese open face sandwich which was okay - not that great. My boyfriend had the fish & chips but while he enjoyed his dinner it also wasn't anything special. We also each had a beer and after tipping we spent over $90. In my opinion that is way too much for the mediocre food that is served. Essentially you are paying for the view.
author: Karisa P.

description: I know it's strange that I chose to eat at a seafood restaurant when I don't even like seafood, but I just really wanted a salad and a beer with a good view. I chose the chopped salad which looked small when it arrived, but as it turned out it was the perfect size for me and was delicious. I thought I was going to have to fork the waiter when he tried to take the salad from me with a couple of bites left to go. The view was nice and didn't smell fishy like some seafood restaurants do. I would go again if ever in the area again.
author: Steph H.

description:
Got a "30 minute wait" despite the place being empty literally empty, and told to eat somewhere else.  I wasn't dressed nice and was with friends, but that shouldn't matter.  Made us feel like we couldn't afford eating there.  

Would rate the food if we were even seated.
author: Nathan S.

description: The view was spectacular but, food was just okay. We ordered oysters, burgers, lobster bisque, fish and chips with drinks . Oh I forgot to mention we loved their dessert. It was delicious. It was the best dish compare to all the dishes we ordered. The service was good. Would come back mostly for the view.
author: Cyndi A.

description: Very slow service. I sat in bar area at high tables and there was only one server. Server seemed overwhelmed and forgot part off my order. Took a very long time for food to come.
author: Tanisha R.

description: We got lucky and were able to be seated immediately, without needing a reservation!  Service was wonderful and the food was superb, we split the Fish & Chips and the Diner Burger.  One of the BEST burgers my husband or I have had at a restaurant!  We would definitely visit this location again!
author: Megan B.

description: Amazing lunch with friends, staff was wonderful and the food was amazing and we had ocean view today and no clouds... Definitely will be back again very soon...
author: Sherry C.

description: Long waiting time, about 2 hours waiting. The food was not presented nicely. Sauce was spilled over my order. Found small hair in my plate, and water cup had something green in it, we asked to change it, they brought the same cup with the same green thing came back
author: Samar H.

description: The food, the asmosphere anf the servicr are amazing and well served. Everything felt really welcomed and warm, especially the server Jenny Green. She was very nice and thorough.
author: Dakki ..

description: Good food, nice atmosphere.  Be careful sitting at the window for dinner, glare and heat.  Good service. Lobster bisque was very good.  Chefs taste menu is a good value.
author: J M.

description: My husband and I drove from San Jose to have dinner here! I was craving their mud pie which is my favorite dessert! Our service was TERRIBLE. We waited in the front to get seated for over 15 min before anyone even noticed we were there. In top of that there was only a few people eating so not sure why we weren't even sat right away.
