The service continued to be terrible. Food was cold by the time it finally got to us. Our service took an hour and a half! Finally ordered the mud pie to be told the kitchen was closed! It's a mud pie! Doesn't need to be cooked. And the kitchen was closed because the service took sooooo long. We arrived 2 hours before closing time. It takes me a lot to get this upset about my service. I actually called and was told to talk to the manager Sarah. Left three message and she still has not called me back!
author: Sarah G.

description: Great view was excited to find this place because I love the Monterey location but the food was disappointing and the service wasn't great won't go back
author: Patricia S.

description: The food was expensive and just okay. But the views were pretty incredible as the sun was setting, so I think that made it worth the visit.
author: Austin N.

description: Great place it has some pretty dam big food and it's by the pier where all the seals are and it's really fun to watch the seals after you eat.
author: Aiden F.

description: There was 7 of us dining. Great location. Below average service from our waitress. We asked for a bread basket she never brought. We had to ask for drink refills. Some silverware was dirty. Food was excellent though. Great calamari, tuna poke, and seafood pasta!
author: Elannie L.

description: It does not take much to make my fiancé and me happy. We sat down at the bar where no one else was sitting and it took 10-15 minutes to just be greeted by the bartender. He was clearly busy with service bar, but acknowledgment would have been nice. We watched the manager stare at the TV and not even ask the bartender if he needed help. It look another 10-15 to even get our drinks. We watched as people continued to sit at the bar and get the same lousy service with no help from any other staff (manager included). As a fellow server I have a problem with this. The food was pretty good but will not be back due to the lack of customer service.
author: Paul D.

description:
Our server Ronaldo was awesome! However we felt really bad for him because of how busy he was, running around taking care of an entire section because the place was so under staffed.

We waited 30mins for our bread, 45mins on oysters & clam chowder, and almost an hour for entrees. Oysters in blue dye ice is not a good idea! Also they were almost no oyster in the shell itself. Plate was hot but food was luke-warm, not the best cioppino I've ever had, considering that the crab legs made work a little to get out of the shell while trying to not get red sauce on myself...

As the night got busier more tables were also being served out of order, like ours. He really tried to make a good impression by giving us a complementary chowder, much appreciated! 

FH Management where were you!? Only saw kitchen managers bussing and running plates! While no one continued to watch the other tables or host station!
author: Jonah S.

description:
Made a reservation for Father's Day. I then came here on yelp and was scared to see all the negative reviews. I went with an open mind and I was ready to wait extra time. To my surprise we got there early and they seated us right away. 

Calamari was delicious as was my husbands Prime Rib, I had  the seafood pasta which was ok. We went with our boys (4yrs and 7months) family friendly environment and the views well what can I say it's the best part. 

I can't remember our waitresses name but she was great also. I was not disappointed, will be going back for some drinks and the calamari.
author: Evelyn O.

description: Great view and even better food. I had the seafood pasta and it's was absolutely incredible.
author: Federico Joaquin D.

description:
The pros: stunning views and lots of natural light. Amazing hummus plate. 

The cons: the service, cold food that took an hour to come out, terrible bloody Mary's, dirty glassware. 

I wasn't expecting a life changing culinary experience at this place, but because they are affiliated with Landry's, I would have thought they would have standards to follow. We had to send back a Bloody Mary that came out way too salty, as well as cold French fries that took an hour to come out. The restaurant manager clearly avoided our table, as he was stopping at each one to encourage guests to sign up for their loyalty program. 

The presentation and taste of the hummus plate was a bright spot. It featured three different kinds - pepper, kalamata olive, and avocado. We enjoyed it tremendously and I will keep the image of how it was presented in my mind for the next time I'm making a platter like that.
author: Christine C.

description:
I really enjoyed the food here, which makes it even more of a shame that the service we experienced was so lousy. 

Despite the fact that we had a reservation, we had to wait for a table and the only one to come available was really hot from unrelenting sun (there are no window shades in that section). They did warn us about the sun before seating us, but we didn't really feel like we could refuse it, because the only other option was an indeterminate wait time. The view from this corner table was fantastic, but I ended up in the worst glare seat and spent the entire dinner in a blaze of hot sun. My water glass went down quick and because the service was so slow, I was thirsty for most of the dinner.

My party ordered a shared seafood platter appetizer which was really delicious. It came quickly, the seafood was well cooked, and the marinade/sauce is spicy and sweet and super sticky. The dish comes with crab crackers and bibs but no extra napkins. We thoroughly enjoyed it, and by the end had seafood shells and sticky greasy sauce all over the place. I really think this dish warranted wet naps or hot towels. Unfortunately, this was when the service really started to lag, and I was just miserable to be trapped in a hot corner, my napkin saturated in sticky fish, my beverage empty, and the table a mess. 

We waited a long time for our entrees, but when they came they were really good. The portions are big and we all enjoyed what we'd ordered. But my second cocktail was served without the garnish (peaches, they ran out), which definitely downgraded it. You can't make a peach cocktail without peaches.  I wasn't offered a chance to change my order, and I was pretty thirsty and desperate by that time, so I drank it anyway but I feel like it should have been discounted or a replacement offered or something. 

After our second course they were able to bus everybody's place at my table expect mine, so I sat in hot mess for the long time it took to finish and pay. I will say, during this whole period I noticed multiple instances of kitchen or host staff running food, staff seeming to help each other out across roles, so it did seem like problem with the service was not the individual efforts of the staff- who overall seemed to be effective- but rather a large scale organizational failure in the restaurant. It was pretty miserable, which hurt when the bill came. 

The food we had was great, but the service would have been objectionable at a restaurant half the price.
author: Emily M.

description:
There is a reason every restaurant at Pier 39 has a waiting list except The Chart House.     The service SUCKS!      Waited at the bar for 14 minutes, bartenders passed us multiple times and would not even greet us.

Everyone else at the bar was having the same issues.    Poor poor slow service.    

We finally were able to ask for water and a beer which only took another 5 minutes.   

Then we had the pleasure of watching our bartender STICK HIS FINGERS INSIDE OF OUR WATER GLASSES to grab them before adding ice and water!     

Obviously some food safety and service issues here.

Paid our bill and went to another restaurant.     Sad, Chart House used to be a solid operation.
author: John G.

description: Chef tasting menu was a great deal.  Beautiful view as it is right on the water. Service was not up to par for an upscale restaurant such as Chart House. Would return since the food and ambience was good.
author: Trish M.

description: Came in on a Saturday afternoon, the restaurant wasn't very busy, we sat right down. Waited for 10 minutes before I had to stand up and get waitress. Our food took forever to come out, I had to ask 4 times before I could get anything I asked for. The food wasn't great and the service made the experience miserable.
author: Kayla N.

description:
I'm recent vegan, and when I asked about vegan options, Carmen our waitress had the chef come out and graciously go over options on the menu and what modifications could be done.  

I ordered the chopped Cobb salad with dressing on the side, added avocado, and the chef made the sides of mushrooms and fingerling potatoes with olive oil instead of butter. Fantastic meal!!!
author: Jen M.

description: Enjoyed our time here. Very busy place. Crab cakes amazing. Considered upscale. It was nice but a little rushed at times. I think we came at a very busy time. Might have been different if that was the case.
author: Tracy W.

description:
This place was underwhelming! A 30 minute wait for a table but it took over an hour for the food to be delivered. 


When the food arrived for our table of seven it was apparent he Food had been setting in the kitchen but not under a warming light. The calamari and fish were  cold to the touch. The lobster Mac n cheese was dry and needed more seasoning.

Not to mention it was freezing in the restaurant and we had to put our jackets back on because the air was blowing.


It gets two stars for the drinks, ambience, and the views.

I'll never return to this place. It reflect poorly on the Landry, Inc. restaurants. It's certainly not McCormick and Schmick's (but it's priced like it is).
author: Sherri B.

description:
Disappointed with the slow service.  Other Chart Houses have a good reputation.   This one was short two bartenders and our orders took amazingly long to prepare.  
But, on to the meal.   
The Coconut Crunchy shrimp, with sauces was delicious!
Main courses for my group included Mahi Sea Bass, Seafood Pasta, Bronze Swordfish, and classic Fish and Chips. All, delightful!!
But with a very expensive bill and a large group, the horribly slow bar service can only rate 2 stars.
author: John H.

description:
We had a really positive experience at the Chart House. 

We booked a table in advance and were seated right away when we arrived. Not sure why there was a 30 min wait for the walk ins behind us, because it seemed like there were plenty of tables.

The best part is obviously the view (because it's impossible to beat), but our service and food experiences were good, too. Our server Calvin was kind and knowledgeable. Our food was cooked beautifully; especially my Chilean sea bass. The clam chowder was worthy of it's San Francisco location. There was one mix up - we were brought the wrong salad. Pretty sure we clearly asked for the spinach salad but received the other chopped salad. They corrected the error and it wasn't a big deal.

We were fortunate to dine during sunset, which was a beautiful sight. And it was super fun to watch the sea lions leave their spot and swim away as it got dark outside.
author: Maria P.

description: I came here with my childhood friend and is almost New Year eve tomorrow, so pier 39 is full no matter where we try to look for place.  So, we decided look no more and just wait for seating.  It was around after 215pm, 20 min wait which not too bad wait.  We were so amazed the host sit us at the corner with the view! It was really awesome and we appreciated.  My friend ordered lunch special calm chowder with salmon and rice $20.  She said the chowder was lukewarm and salmon was not bad but very small portion.   As for me, I ordered crab louie salad $20, a bowel calm chowder $7.  Yes I agreed the soup lukewarm, but no taste at all, have to put lots of salt.  The salad was too much dressing and very little crab but maybe for $20 is cheap price? We got what we pay for ? It was pretty looking plate, glad I took one pic of the meal.  See attached.   We were really wish to stay longer drinking out hot tea, but the host and waiter giving us sigal "is there anything you need?" We know there is long line and we have to go.  We didn't stay long, just finished our meal and feel little rush and go (we understand long wait for others too).  The food ok, but come for the view is excellent! The service not bad after all, we don't need much once we seated.  Thanks!
author: Kitty L.

description: Visted this place on a trip out to S.F. the salad was on point but the black'n chicken pasta was not good.  The staff was great.
author: Isaiah W.

description:
The best thing about this place is there is no wait (probably for to the price) and the view is amazing.   Pier 39 in general is difficult to find restaurants that have less than a 30-50 minute wait so.....

The food is pretty good.  They cooked my swordfish just right and most places over heat swordfish so that it's dry.

Decent gluten free menu which was a beautiful sight for my wife.  Again, most seafood driven places so not have a big gf menu.  Mainly because they deep fry in wheat based breading.

Waiter was super attentive and knowledgeable which was appreciated after dealing with the touristy masses in the pier.
author: Ben H.

description: What great service! Doing the tourist thing at Pier 39, and found a gem. Jenny at the bar was fantastic! Her personality and drinks were second to none. We are locals, but we will be back!
author: Jeff T.

description: The main issue was the service. The person at the reception was not friendly and arrogant. We did not feel welcome. We asked a highchair 3 times. Really cold atmosphere in general and poor customer service. Nice view and the quality of the food is pretty good.
author: Beatrice V.

description:
For starters, beautiful view of the bay. Didn't have to fight for window seating because there was hardly anybody at the restaurant. Granted it was a Monday around 5pm but I figured this place would be busy for happy hour? Nope. I came here with my boyfriend and we sat at the high tables for happy hour. Our server was pleasant and accommodating, didn't have any problems there. I've read that customer service is a hit or miss, mainly miss but we didn't have any problems on this occasion. 

The menu seems to be more on the Asian side with a lot of kimchi flavors and tons of seafood options, which there should be. The drink menu was your standard with martinis and mojitos and wines. I went with the mango mojito which was a bit sweet but not strong at all. A bit disappointing paying $9 for basically juice. 

Appetizers were okay. We opted for the shrimp, calamari, and mussels. The portions were on the smaller side and the overall flavor was just okay. Nothing really stood out to me. I would hate to pay full price for any of the items I had that day, that's why I would only say come by for happy hour. 

The low ratings are fair for Chart House. Average service and average food with a beautiful view. I'm sure other places in the pier area have the same nice view with better food.
author: Melissa M.

description: I spent my birthday here last year and the food was simply amazing! Oyster Rockefeller were definitely my favorite! The best ones I've had so far!!!! The service was also great. The setting was also great. It has a great view of the bay. It was just the perfect place to spend a birthday! Would definitely go back here again!
author: Michelle S.

description: Really good service in the bar and a great view over the bay. Alcatraz and Golden gate.
author: Magnus O.

description:
We were hoping for a much better experience from a Landry's Restaurant. We are Landry's club members and have never had a problem with any of their other restaurants thus far however this was not an experience we'll share again. 

We ordered the fish tacos and the appetizer seafood platter. They were way overpriced. The fish tacos had absolutely no flavor. They treated like boiled fish and dry cabbage ( I guess you could call that a flavor just not a good one). The saving grace was there appetizer seafood platter. It had so much spice and flavor that we could put the fish with it and it helped. 

The greeting that you got when you walked in the front door needs to be addressed. Because my husband happened to be in a t-shirt that day they looked him up and down. Good thing for our waiter, he was friendly but unfortunately didn't come around so often. The flatware was dirty. The waitress at the next table was extremely rude to her busser who accidentally dropped a plate. She could have held herself and spoke to her in private. I know this is a big city but they really need to get it together.

For two appetizers and one draft beer, and tip, we dropped $100.

Will not be coming back!
author: Hope M.

description:
The service was awesome. The staff was friendly and kind. The View was unbeatable and islands and sea lions and the Golden Gate Bridge.

The food however, was on edible. Crab melt look like somebody had vomited it onto a plate with overbearing cheese melted on it. The child hamburger was start at the bottom and my five-year-old refuse to touch it. And yet we magically still had to pay for all of it so I spent $52 on food that we didn't eat
author: Sonya E.

description:
So sad to see the negative reviews! Me and my partner had an amazing experience! We are locals and ended up at this lovely restaurant by just browsing through the pier. The hostess was sweet and helpful and the waitress was very helpful in accommodating our dietary limitations. 

The food was fabulous. We had the shrimp ceviche with mango salsa and plantain chips on a lightly fried panko crusted avocado. Simply yum! It was followed by a tasty Seafood Cobb that they split onto two plates for us since we were sharing. We didn't even request the separate platings, it was this nice gesture that they did with our entree of Coconut Shrimp as well. Such attention to detail was greatly appreciated.

It was lovely to have the manager Farrah check in on us as well as the dining room manager Broderick. Both were very warm, welcoming and friendly and genuinely sincere. Our waitress Jenny and Nick were very bright and alert. We could tell the staff greatly enjoyed working with each other and had great respect for one another. 

The view was remarkable, the food wonderful and the customer service level generated high marks. We will definitely add this to our roster of restaurants to frequent!

Way to go Chart House!!!


Roberto
author: Roberto R.

description: Great all around food. Had chillin seabass with lobster topping and shared crab. Very fresh. Not salty at all like in Florida. We enjoyed it very much.
author: Jon K.

description:
We came on a pretty dead Tuesday night. The table was reserved via a hotel concierge so that apparently got us "VIP status". First off, the view is absolutely amazing; you can't beat having dinner right in front of the SF sunset WITHOUT having to suffer the bone chilling winds. For appetizers, we got the crab avocado mango stack and the kimchi calamari. The calamari was pretty good, and the portion was very generous. The flavour was very Asian and I didn't get any hint of kimchi. The crab stack was mediocre at best; as the pungent bite from the raw onions way overshadowed the taste of everything else.

For entree I got the bronzed swordfish fish, as recommended by the server, at a steep price of $39! "This better be good", I thought. The dish came served by the chef on a moderately hot plate. He didn't talk about the dish at all apart from saying "be careful of the hot plate", so wasn't sure what the purpose of him coming out was. The fish had good texture, but was incredibly bland. The lump crab on top tasted ok, but was rather watery. As for the sides of potatoes and asparagus, I've definitely had better ones. 

Thanks to our VIP status, we did get a complimentary lava cake, which turned out to be the highlight of the night. The server said it's made from scratch so it took awhile for it to come out. When it did, however, the cake was completely crumbled into bits because the ice cream was too heavy to be placed on top of it; the "lava" was still very hot nonetheless. 

All in all, the food were rather disappointing and could use a lot of improvements. Service was all right, but the view made everything A-OK.
author: Ivy W.

description:
So my colleagues and I stopped in here to eat dinner there were 6 of us.  We sat down and first thing we asked if to have separate checks.  The waitress said she would split it up evenly between the 6 of us and that is not what we asked for.  Anyway so we ordered drinks it took some time for them to be served.  It was time to order our food and everyone ordered.  After she put the order in she brought us our check and said this is what will be on your check we can add to it if you want more.  That was a little strange.

So the food came and I got the tuna taco appetizer the ceviche tuna was very flavorful the taco itself was not.  One of the girls got the crab stack and it was awesome.  Great flavor lots of crab and avocado really good.  A couple of them got the trio of soups and they said it was really good as well.

So now it comes time to pay the check.  All but one of us paid with card no big deal right!  Well the waitress says to her why don't you just pay with a card like the rest in a nasty tone.  Karen say because I don't want to.  So she takes our payment.  She brings back all of the card payments and not the change of the girl who paid cash. Karen asked for her change and she says I am working on it.  So before she walks off one of the other girls asked if she could have a 20 dollar bill broken for change.  She goes back break the 20 and brings it back to her and not the change for the girl who paid cash.  What is up with that.  She was so rude to her it was she was just so strange.  This was not a good experience!!!
author: Dona S.

description: No better spot for lunch on Pier 39!  Checked out the sea lions next door and then enjoyed lunch with the most amazing view of Alcatraz and the bay!  The hummus trio appetizer was great and the chicken sandwich hit the spot.  Enjoy!
author: Matt M.

description: The best restaurant at Pier 39. Prompt and personal service from our host and waitress  made the visit all the more memorable. A window table with an unobstructed views of Alcatraz and the sea lions was simply awesome.  The food was equally fantastic. The filet mignon with lobster mac n cheese was delicious as well as the fish n chips and burger and fries. The wine and the local brew matched beautifully with our meal. The chocolate lava cake at the end capped a wonderful experience among the chaos at this tourist mecca.
author: Chris S.

description:
I took my friends here from Chicago because this was one of the very few restaurants with a bar that was open late.

We just went in and sat at the bar. Since we were the only ones, service was quick.

We ordered long islands and oh my gosh, they were one of the best long islands I've ever had!

If you're looking for a place to just drink, definitely get the long island.

Our bartender was really nice and friendly as well which made our night better!
author: Aj C.

description: My boyfriend came here for our anniversary and it was a wonderful experience. It was my first time here and the food was great. Our waiter was fantastic! He even brought us a free dessert for celebrating our anniversary. Great service, great food and a great view!
author: Taylor B.

description:
Played a tourist and went to Pier 39 with an appetite. OK, so this place is getting a ton of negative reviews. Like someone else said, it has only been in business for a few months. My experience was a mixed one.

The young lady who checked us in was very friendly, and had us seated almost immediately. Our server was just as friendly and took our drink orders as soon as we'd been seated. He informed us that they didn't have any beer on tap. This was a little disappointing.

The garlic bread appetizer was average. I ordered Clam Chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was pretty good. Not the best I've had though.

Ultimately, I'm giving stars for the service and the spectacular view. It's not as bad as a lot of people here are saying. Really. Not sure if I'd come back though.
author: John F.

description: Great location at end of Pier 39. Bar is very nice. Great strawberry fields salad. Service was good but slow. Had shelled dungenes crab and shelled lobster. Both were bland and over cooked Unfortunately.
author: Beaumont J.

description: Food was good although a bit on the pricey side.  View was phenomenal, service was great, decor and furnishings were beautiful, got there right when it opened therefore got seated immediately.
author: Jacob D.

description:
Chart House is located in a prime tourist spot, at Pier 39, at the end of the pier, right above where the sea lions hang out.

The views are indeed spectacular. However, just like all the other Yelp reviews, the food and service are lacking.

We spent major coin here and the level of service was subpar.  Drinks that I ordered were forgotten about or took more than half an hour to receive.

I ordered a blackened fish and it was cooked extremely salty and dry.  This is not the place to get a flaky, light fish.  One thing I do recommend is the kimchi calamari appetizer which was very good.  Also the crab cakes and oysters were good.  

I would advise you to avoid this place unless you want to have a view on the water and don't mind overspending for subpar service and food.  This place is a tourist trap.
author: Dan L.

description: This is great place. The views of the San Francisco Bay is amazing. The food is really good. The service was the great. It is a little pricey but worth the price.
author: Michael G.

description:
I found this restaurant to be very good. The location is spectacular with a modern interior that is beautiful. Nice bar area for single diners or quick meals or simply awaiting your table. Lots of wines to choose from & craft cocktails. Dinner menu has ample options for all tastes (steak, burgers, crustaceans, fish). Service was a bit o the slow side considering it was a Tuesday night and the place was maybe half full. But that may be why they were slow - small crew for a slow night. 
Food was served hot & delicious. Every dish we ordered was tasty & worth the money. 
Our waiter, while a bit neglectful, was a sweet young man who did a great job overall 
I would definitely eat here again.
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
At almost 200.00 for dinner for two adults and a child, I really did expect better.  I ordered the fresh Dungeness crab (market price, over 50.00) that was so over cooked I couldn't get a solid piece of meat out of it, it flaked apart like tuna.  My husband had a huge prime rib, and by the time the server brought his horseradish, his meat was cold.  They offered us a free desert.  Really? Should have saved a ton of cash (and a trip into the city) and gone to outback.  At least if they over cook something they will bring you another.  Stay classy The Charthouse.  

Seating took just a couple of minutes, excellent for a Saturday evening!  The server was super friendly, and luckily the wine was good.  

Will NOT be going back.
author: Doree A.

description: For being one of the most touristy spots in San Fran, you would expect the place to be adequately staffed. Wrong. We went in for two drinks each. Service was agonizingly slow, and when we were ready to pay the tab, we put our cards down and waited for 35 minutes with no one even acknowledging us. I then proceeded to hold my card and check in the air for another 10 minutes. All I wanted to do was give them my money and leave. 45 minutes just to pay is not acceptable anywhere. The bartender was incredible snippy also. Understandably as he was the only one staffing a bar with about 30 people sitting there. Management needs to get this under control.
author: Bryson N.

description:
My husband and I decided to head out to SF for our Anniversary. Originally I booked Sutro's at the Cliff House for our dinner but decided on Chart House. See my parents went to Chart House in Monterey (review to follow) and had such a great experience I hoped to get the same experience here, and I did! 

We were running a bit behind and my husband called to let them know and they said it would not be a problem. Upon arrival it seemed a little busy but we were greeted and asked to wait just a bit.  They sat us right along the windows above the water and it was beautiful, however the sun was a little bright. They were more than happy to move us to a booth close by with the same view. The view by he way was gorgeous! We were able to clearly see the Golden Gate, Alcatraz, Angel Island etc. we were so entertained by all the nature and happenings. Seals, pelicans, boats, swimmers etc. 

Our waitress greeted us with a "Happy Anniversary" and handed us a card. She made us aware that she was training her companion Rory in advance. Her customer service really made our night. She was so accommodating, patient and spoke eloquently. I honestly felt like royalty! She asked how our drinks were, she asked if our food was made to perfection (perfection people) lol and it was! She constantly checked in to make sure we had water and anything else we might need. She was on top of everything.

All that we devoured was delicious!
- Cucumber Martini
Refreshing! A little sweeter than expect but still very good. 
- Dungeness Crab Louie
Absolutely delicious! We shared this plate and we were basically fighting over it lol. The crab was fresh and very tasty. A must try. 
- Prime Rib with a side of Yukon Gold garlic mashed potatoes. 
Cooked perfectly as ordered, wonderful tender prime rib. The mashed potatoes were good. 
-Dungeness Crab Melt
My husband orders this with a side of sweet potato fries. Very good and very fresh. I love all the freshness this restaurant has to offer. The sweet potato fries were equally as good. 

To end the evening our waitress surprised us with dessert on the house for our Anniversary. She brought it out with a lite candle and all, so sweet!  I did not find the dessert on the menu by apparently it was the mudpie! We were so stuffed but this dessert was so delicious! It was that sweet with a hint of salt dessert, the ice cream and crust really complimented each other. My husband is not a sweet tooth and he could not stop eating it lol. 

Ultimately, I had the perfect dinner experience. The customer attentiveness was on point. Our waitress went over and beyond to make this dinner special.  

Thank you Chart House for everything! It was the beginning of our celebration and it couldn't have been better. We're taking you up on your offer, welcoming us back annually for our anniversary. #newanniversarytradition.
author: Juvie C.

description:
Amazing personalized service for our anniversary! 
We were visiting SF for a nice weekend anniversary get away and I made reservations for the Chart House for our special dinner. I added that it was our 28th in the notes and they went out of the way to make it special for us! Everyone called us by name, wished us Happy Anniversary, and our menus even had our name and Happy Anniversary printed on them!
We waited for a few moments at the bar for our table. I ordered a pretty layered margarita that I think was called the Vineyard. It was very good! Within about 5 minutes, the host walked over and invited us by name to follow him to the table.
At our table, we had the best service I think I have ever had. Alexa was our server and extremely knowledgeable about everything on the menu with wonderful suggestions. I followed her recommendation for the Mahi, blackened with the Baja topping - sauteed shrimp, avocado, and corn salsa. Hubby has the Dungeness Crab which has very tasty, but he had forgotten how much work crab is. I'm supposed to remind him that he doesn't want to work that hard again, but that's not anything on the Chart House. They had it prepped wonderfully.
For dessert, they brought us the mud pie all decorated for us with candles.
Beyond the service and the food, the location of this Chart House is perfect. It is at the end of Pier 39 with sweeping views of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. We had a perfect window table for sunset. 
The manager stopped by and all the staff were very attentive.
It was an amazing night. Thank you!
author: Laurie A.

description:
My mind was set on having a sourdough bowl with clam chowder for lunch, but I wanted to have a couple good drinks and a great view as well. My quest was solved at Chart House!  Looking at some of the past scores, it must have been an isolated incident for each guest. 

The waiter did need to be flagged down and the bartender took his time, but the drinks had a lot of flavor and were decently strong. The chowder was good and the bread bowl was just what I was looking for.  My daughter is very picky and she didn't see anything she wanted so she followed my lead and said this was the best non-Asian food she's ever had!

My wife got the French dip and she couldn't put the sandwich down. Another guest at our table had the same sandwich and loved it. Another guest tried the lobster bisque in a bread bowl and loved it. 

The prices were not too bad considering your view is of the bay, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Can't get a better spot on the wharf!
author: Jon-paul N.

description: The staff here was amazing.  My husband was feeling really bad after walking around the pier on a really hot day. He needed a place to cool off and rest. The hostess' offered to let us sit in the bar area. The bartenders supplied us with ice and came by to check on us a couple of times. Very caring staff. I can't wait to come back next time and actually eat here.
author: Michele T.

description:
Beautiful view of the bay/Alcatraz since it is located at the end of Pier 39.. Server was courteous and efficient. Food arrived relatively quickly, even for our party of 7. 

Clam chowder and Caesar salad were delicious!
author: Bevan J.

description: I am so disappointed. It's Wednesday night and there's no one here. It's impossible to get a drink either from the bar or at our table. We can't even get the server to take appetizer orders. The view is great but the service is an abomination! At first I wondered why there were so few people here.... now I know why.
author: Chris M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the world for basic meat and potatoes with a fabulous view is the chart house at Pier 39 in San Francisco.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Super slow/no service.  We had to bail after sitting down for 30 minutes. We had a reservation for 6:45.  They would not seat us early even though the place was not full so we went back just before 6:45, waited for 5 minutes.  We had a great table by the window.  No water or anything until we asked 15 minutes later.  Then. 15 more minutes without anyone coming by to acknowledge us.  The place was half empty.
author: Stella S.

description:
From the moment we walked in , the atmosphere seemed different from the chart house locations I have been to , I asked for a window seat and she told me it would be about 25-30 minutes . I said I would wait around 40 minutes she sent a text to me saying my table was ready . We came to the front to check in she said to wait and the hostess would seat us . We waited 10 minutes and then asked about being seated and she said " oh  I will seat you.
We get to the table
And it's not a window seat, she said she did not have it written down,  ( there were 3 window tables open) I spoke to the manager and then she moved us after I asked. It took the waiter 15 minutes to bring us water and about the same every time I asked for water or bread ..  my prime rib was dry and cold and I verified that  if I requested medium it would be warm middle.This was the most disappointing dinner I have had at a chart house and plan never to return to this location .
author: Thomas L.

description:
Terrible, ruined our 2017 NYE.  Travelled 700miles for dinner overlooking the bay.  Booked 10 days ago a table for 2 at 1015p 21/31/16.  Had asked for a window to see the fireworks, but was called 3 days before to confirm and that would not be able to see fireworks.  Ok, thanks for letting us know.  So far, so good.

Turned up tonight - NYE at 10p for 1015p reservation be told that precious diners are overstaying and that the restaurant is over capacity and now cannot honor any reservations.   When asking what they suggest we do - really sorry but tonight is out of control.

Genuinely at a loss for words - never had this happen before and certainly not on a special night.

For a large establishment in a busy tourist location - should be ashamed of their performance.  Never trust Chart House with dinner again.

Happy 2017!
author: Roger S.

description:
Came to this spot because I thought hey looks nice, new place and a steakhouse! 
OHHH man was I disappointed! 

1-I was told wait was 2 1/2 if I didn't have a reservation
(I understand it was Valentine's Day but really the bar was open sitting, there was at least 4-5 tables open, the host, (short hair lady) told me they were very full. 
That was a lie!

2-I sat down waited about 20-30 minutes for someone to finally say "I'll be right with you" 
That right away meant 20 mins! 

3-I actually had to go up and get my own menu.

4-Table was dirty server knew but did nothing about it till I said something.

On a good note though:
The food was pretty good BUT I HAD TO WAIT 1hr and 20 mins for my FOOOOODD! 
The lava cake is very good! I got lucky I ordered it as soon as I got my food.  

Overall I think this place can be awesome, but someone in management has to step in and run things the right way.  Everyone just looked like they were lost. 

OHHH AND WAIT! 

5- The RESTROOM had a freaking line cause they only had one RESTROOM FOR BOTH AND ALL WOMAN, MEN, and I guess staff! 

A bad experience, and I won't be going back!
author: Luis A.

description:
Great service and experience from start to finish. Before the place even opened, the hostess kindly answered our questions about the menu and view. Got a great table, had a great waiter. Started with bloody marys... they were delish, but be sure to upgrade to the Proud Mary if you want a big ole shrimp garnish--wish the waiter would have mentioned it when I initially ordered the bloody mary. Luckily I was able to upgrade halfway through my drink.
Oysters and crunchy coconut shrimp appetizers were excellent and the dipping sauces were amazing! Lobster bisque and crab louie salads hit the spot. 
The only reason I'm not giving it 4 stars is because one side of our table was really dirty. 
I highly recommend it if you are looking for something yummy to eat while enjoying a great view of the bay!
author: Amanda B.

description:
Place is empty and waited 15 minutes with no service at the bar.  Person in the front clueless and said byeeeee.  No wonder thisb place has bad reviews.  Time for new management 


Tilman  you do not know what is happening here #billiondollarbuyer
author: Juan B.

description: Visited for happy hour. Great service and food.  Manager Roderick was very nice and attentive.
author: K W.

description: Not as good as the original Neptune's's Palace but the service was nice, and the food was good. Still an amazing clam chowder, and the chopped spinach salad that someone in our party had was quite good, as well. High marks for the bacon cheddar cheeseburger. Good french fries and fun view of the sea lions, if you sit on the west side.
author: Ludwina O.

description:
Restaurant was unable to honor our reservation - nor, I gather, that of anyone who reserved after around 9PM. The host staff, who were totally overwhelmed, told us to return after midnight! This was supposed to be an anniversary dinner, but that clearly was off the agenda if the Chart House wasn't going to be seating us until (literally) the next day. Given the lateness of the hour and paucity of other eating options at that time, we reluctantly acquiesced.

When we returned *at the stated time*, they attempted to claim that they were now closed... an amazingly shoddy business practice. The manager, who might be expected to be at the forefront of all crises, seemingly had no idea that this fiasco was taking place, nor that the restaurant had been turning away reserved guests for hours! We insisted (only because every other establishment nearby was closed for the evening) and were eventually seated, nearly three hours late.

As far as I can tell, this establishment suffers from a complete lack of effective leadership, with a clueless GM who leaves the staff to swing in the breeze when times get tough. If I were the Chart House (or perhaps parent company Landry), I would seriously wonder what exactly I was paying this manager to do, because a quick scan of Yelp is all it takes to realize the depths of their incompetence. It's worth mentioning that we did not once hear an apology to ourselves or any other similarly affected customers!

After all the tribulation, the food itself was tasty and our server (who had clearly been bearing the brunt of pissed off customers all night) was wonderful despite his obvious fatigue. My suggestion: take a page from the local football team's book and replace the manager, stat. I'm not sure this business can withstand many more nights like this one before its reputation is indelibly tarnished.
author: Lleandryn M.

description:
Mediocre service 
Food was not good
Prime rib sent back first time around second time still over cooked
Burger my daughter ordered was like a hockey puck 
Pasta seafood just fair
True tourist trap on pier 39
Ambiance was beautiful though
author: William T.

description: One of my favorite meals while visiting San Francisco. Lobster Bisque, lobster Mac and cheese and coconut shrimp were all amazing. Service was exceptional. Views were spectacular. Definitely would recommend and come again.
author: Nafesa K.

description: I would not even waste my time to write this review except I feel the need to warn others not to even bother with this place. We were there for 20 minutes, never got served. Then we we asked about it, the waitress gave us attitude. We immediately left. Go down to the crab house, it's awesome and not near as pretentious !!
author: Cece C.

description: If you have ever been to the Chart House in Monterey, do not go to this Pier 39 location.  You will be sorely disappointed.   It was unbelievable to my husband and I how the two places could share the same name.  Monterey has world class food and salad bar.  Everything about it is high end.  Pier 39 should be show stopper based on location and view.  But that's where the comparison ends.  Waitress very kind and service was fine so I need to add that before I get to the bad part.  It's the food.  It is mediocre.  My husband ordered prime rib.  No seasoning and bland.  It came with a yukon gold mashed potatoes.  He says they were probably more seasoned than anything else he ate.  But $38 and not a sprig of a garnish or vegetable with it?  I had the seafood platter.  $29.   Fried calamari, fish, coconut shrimp and "skinny" fries.   How can anyone screw up fries you might ask ...well....they were lukewarm, no seasoning and lifeless.   Coconut shrimp was best item on the plate.  Calamari, not good, lukewarm.  Fish, looked like Vandekamps fish fillets.  Just huge and unattractive on the plate.   Here is the best part - came with three sauces.    Ok, you might say, here's the good stuff.   NOT.  None of the sauces were made from scratch.  WHAT??  I'm at the Chart House and they cannot make their own tarter sauce?  One of the sauces was not cocktail sauce which I found interesting with the food served.  I have never been so disappointed in seeing $150 fly out the door and for what?  I could have had shrimp cocktail from the street vendor and not felt so ripped off.  The manager at The Chart House needs to wake up.
author: Pam S.

description:
Checked in and was told it would be 30 mins for a table and they would text me.. after an hour I returned and our group had apparently been forgotten..
No apologies were given.. 20 minutes later we were finally seated, noting most of the restaurant was empty?? ( unsure what the wait was for?)
Good was pretty good once we got it, but service was pretty low for the price tag..
author: Shawn B.

description: Awesome view, takes reservations so you're guaranteed a table... too bad they have you pay for their Landry's Club then when they don't credit a check of over $200 to your account they want you to fix it yourself instead of making an internal contact to one of their restaurants. I loved Neptune's & still love the view. I like chart house, but this trip was the 1st time in 5 years we tried other places in the area because it wasn't as great as it used to be.
author: Donna R.

description:
We were so excited to go here and could not have been more disappointed. There were 4 of us, we sat in the bar over looking the water.  Waited, waited, waited then FINALLY a waitress. Although happy to finally get service out waitress could not have been worse. She was incredibly quiet and never once cracked a smile. We ordered appetizers to start before our dinner. Waited, waited, waited then FINALLY just as we were about to ask, our food came out. Sadly it all came at the exact same time, over crowding our table leaving us no room. If that weren't bad enough, we didn't even get what we ordered. I know, crazy right! I'd like to say the bad experience ended there, but it really didn't. We ordered a few more drinks, I of course didn't get what I ordered..... AGAIN!!! I thought maybe we were on a prank show or something. I was waiting for Ashton Kutcher to pop out. There's no way this could really happen at a nice restaurant!! Our frowney-faced waitress rarely came to our table and when she did it was just AWFUL. The time came for the check and we were ready to go. Our waitress approached the table, tossed our bill onto it then walked away. We ended up just paying cash because SHE NEVER CAME BACK!!!!! 
It's unfortunate because the food was actually really good.
author: Elyse M.

description:
Bread was fresh and very delicious, but wasn't house bread you automatically get. We had to order it as an appetizer. I would have liked to get house bread on our table. We have a 1 year old and this place is more on the fancy side. They welcomed our family with no qualms. We asked for a window view and they obliged. We were also seated right away with no wait. Bathrooms were very clean and well kept. Food was delicious. Would would like to see more non-sea food appetizers and meals on the menu, as I do not like sea food, but my husband does. 
Over all I would recommend this Restraunt to family and friends.
author: Mrs.Rosenberg 8.

description: The food was delicious. I had the flier and mashed potatoes, my husband had the prime rib and mashed potatoes, all of which was tasted and cooked to perfection! The wait was the worse! However, they did give him a free bday dessert. I would've given them five stars despite this, but we weren't even offered a glass of water after waiting 45mins to be seated, but to their defense the manager did check on us, which we totally appreciated because before then it felt as Gouche we were being overlooked. So, kudos to the manager for that!!
author: Anony M.

description: The food here is amazing. Wonderful swordfish and seared tuna. Tropical topping and Baja toppings made them even more tasty. Service, not very good at all. Cleared extra spaces at our table after we had our food, didn't refill our water when only one of us had an extra drink, never received the complementary bread basket and the kitchen had to deliver our food. Super nice guy but not so super at his job. The only "nice" place we went during our vacation in San Fransisco and were somewhat disappointed. For the price we paid for food,drinks and atmosphere, I would like better table service. Sorry, Julio. After traveling and being in the service industry for 10+ Year's I am disappointed.
author: Keely V.

description: My friend and I traveled straight after work from Reno to San Francisco to get to packet pick up for Bay to Breakers race by 5 PM. After a way too slow stop and go drive down we luckily made it in at around 430.  After rushing through the the Expo it was definitely time for cocktails!!! On the drive down my friend told me about a key lime martini recipe she got from a bartender in Las Vegas. The hunt was on! After striking out at the first two bars (no vanilla vodka) we ran into this place. When we walked in and saw the oh so mightily stocked bar we knew we hit the right place. We sat right down at the bar and after a few minutes of being taken by awe of the incredible view of the Pacific we turned back to see the ever smiling face of our bartender. We asked if he could make us the key lime martini and he so graciously let us give him the recipe to try. I must say, he rocked it! After sipping our tasty drinks for a few minutes we decided to order some nibbles. We ended up ordering the Shrimp, Crab, Avocado & Mango Stack (Dungeness crab & bay shrimp tossed in remoulade, layered with avocado & mango).  I must say, the presentation was impressive but the flavor and freshness was right on! The nice size portion of crab meat blended effortlessly with the fresh avocado and mango. About half way through we ordered another key lime martini and relaxed into easy conversation with the guy next to us who said he comes here just for their clam chowder. (he ended up ordering a key lime martini his wife who was on her way over). If we had more time we definitely would have stayed longer and ordered more items. I will just have to wait until my next trip out.
author: Amy S.

description: Don't get the low ratings. Food was good. Service was perfect. View is amazing! Will definitely come back.
author: Alireza P.

description: My experience at chart house was awesome! We had an amazing view of the bay where we could see both Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Our  waiter was sweet and the food was exceptional. I got the whole Dungeness crab and it was steamed to perfection. Well worth the market price $45! My girlfriend described her blackened chicken pasta as "the best pasta she's ever had." Overall, a great experience and I would definitely recommend it for anyone. I wish I could eat here everyday!
author: Dominic P.

description: Food is lovely the Irish staff are excellent workers very friendly. We enjoyed a Filet mignon, seafood pasta and two beautiful starters. The manager came to our table and he is lovely. Service and food is 5 star
author: Sarah G.

description: The only reason anyone would go to Chart House is for the views so if you are going then request a table by the water. If you don't get one, then walk out. The food is subpart and overpriced and the service is extremely slow. The only saving grace is that while you are waiting on you below average food you can take in the views of Alcatraz, see some seals swimming in the water, and people watch the Pier. I'd say you are better off spending some time outdoors on the Pier than coming to this restaurant.
author: Priya S.

description:
Absolutely perfect dining experience! 
My wife and I came to SF for our 7th Anniversary and had our celebratory dinner at Chart house Pier 39. Can't say enough how happy we were with our experience. My wife had the filet mignon which was cooked to perfection. I had the captains cut of prime rib which literally cut like butter. Yum. Thanks for making US feel special on our special day!
Bill Gear Sr.
author: Billy G.

description:
I was so sad to see that Neptunes was gone, but we decided to try it anyway for my birthday.

The claim chowder was super watery, had way too much pepper and not many clams.  The Crab Melt was luke warm and not all that great.

The only saving grace was our waiter was really sweet.  Nice guy named Terry.

Not a fan
author: Allison H.

description:
Never again.

Pro: The manager on duty was great...

Cons:...As a server/bartender. He seemed to be the only one doing everyone's job.

Went here to grab a bite ($$) and a few drinks. 

First hiccup- when I ordered my drink they didn't have the right ingredients and didn't know how to correctly make it in the first place. Instead of asking for my alternative, the handsome bartender showed up with his version. Which was okay, but run it by the patron first. 

Second issue: place was half empty and it took forever to get seated.... Actually it took forever to get everything. Then the waiter was upset that the manager saw to his tables. Don't get upset because you're not doing your job.


The food was okay, but not worth the hassle. I ended up getting my food to go because I was so irritated by the atmosphere.

Once more. The manager was awesome. He shouldn't have to do everyone's job.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Apps and drinks only at bar area. Ridiculously slow service and it wasn't even busy. 
Hummus appetizer with plantain & pita chips was amazing & oysters on half shell were fresh and good. Decor is amazingly beautiful. Can't beat the views right at the edge of the Pier. Used to be Neptunes. Will be back & hope service is better.
author: Leah D.

description: Melissa- their Chef made our day truly memorable.She accommodated our request for vegetarian food and how !! We will not forget how well they treated us and how delicious the  food was!  While most restaurants go crazy with special requests on weekends, Chart house staff made us feel so welcome and special. A well spent Sunday afternoon at Chart House, I must say. I'm going there again!
author: JanGun P.

description:
I should've read the reviews before entering. This place has an excellent view, but that's about it. Went there after a day spent at Alcatraz and the menu was a little incomplete. When we tried to order oysters we were told that they were out for the day. The party I was with chose this spot because of the oysters so for us to find this out after we ordered drinks and were ready to eat was beyond disappointing. Additionally, the chef didn't know where the scallops were from and the prime rib was nearly all fat. The drinks were fine and the service was good, but I will not return ever again.

One other note, a friend pointed an item out on the bottom of the menu that says the restaurant also charges customers an extra 5% tax on all bills for the "cost of doing business" in San Francisco. It would be nice if that 5% would provide actual oysters or decent menu items that we could enjoy.
author: David G.

description:
The food is decent but the service is BAD! The hostess said the wait was 2 1/2 hours long but they looked like they weren't as busy. The bar was open seating and the hostess said they were full but i found a table. Took them 20 min to give us menus after we sat down and we had to go up and ask for it. The table was not clean and we again had to as them to wipe it off. 
I blame the management because the restaurant is highly disorganized in the way they do things. The sections of the restaurant were not properly managed. 
The food took a really LONG time to come out. I saw that other customers around us were unhappy as well and some just got up and left. 
Don't go to charter house unless you have patience to be there for 2 hours.
author: Couture A.

description:
The view is great if you can get a window seat. Saw lots of ferries, boats, water taxis during our entire dinner gliding across the bay.  BFF's hubby wanted to dine at a restaurant where there was a view and to have the "mud pie" for dessert.  

We tried the following:
1. Coconut shrimp appetizer, 6 prawns fried with a nice coconut flavor over a bed of fried rice noodles (vermicelli) in a fried, shell-shaped rice bowl which we broke apart and ate like chips.
2. Kim Chee Calamari - a huge plate easily shared by 4 or more. Not really any kim chee flavor, just fried calamari and vegts with a spicy kick to it. Came with 3 dipping sauces - all sweet.
3. Prime rib 10 oz.  - 3 of us had this, the meat was tender and seasoned, cooked med-rare as ordered.  Just delicious.  Didn't like Hubby's mashed potatoes which came with his meat as it had a funny taste/flavor, as if someone use stale milk/buttermilk to mix in it.  
The 3 of them added 'crab' topping on the side, a glob of shredded crab all drippy and wet was on the plated. I opted not to try that, but helped myself to several bites of Hubby's prime rib.  Not one to order prime rib/steaks, etc. at restaurants, I would definitely order this one if I were to return. 
4. Nut crusted mahi-mahi - was OK, sort of bland except for the sweet mango salsa on top of it which I didn't like.  The pyramid of rice and green beans were OK.

My dining companions had cocktails, I liked Hubby's Fleur dy Lis because of the coconut flavor.  I had a glass of merlot from Napa Valley, $10, which was very good.

Dessert:
1. Creme Brulee - it was OK, have had better
2. Coffee Mud Pie - covered with choc. syrup and a nice choc. cookie layer on the bottom. It reminded us of the mud pie served at Chart House when it used to be located down the peninsula years ago. 

Our waiter, Victor, was friendly and checked in on us continuously, offering to fill our water glasses multiple times.  I noticed my wine glass was still dirty when he brought it and took it back to exchange for a new glass.  Hubby did notice there was another wait staff who was setting up another table across the room and had dropped the bread plate on the floor but instead of taking it back to the kitchen, he continued to set the table.  This is where a bit more staff training would be needed as "customer eyes" are everywhere in the dining room.
author: Ry T.

description:
First off, we came during Memorial Day weekend so it was busy everywhere. My husband and I decided to eat here, it sounded better than waiting over an hour for Bubba Gumps. 
I have worked in restaurants before, so I watch the wait staff and see how they do things here. Biggest pet peeve was the bartender- he was cutting lemons and limes behind the bar, but then he would touch menus and the computer and help guests. That is absolutely disgusting, and a health violation. This is not a cheap place- pretty sure they can afford a box of gloves. 
Waiter took awhile to greet us. He was very quiet, didn't annunciate so he was hard to understand. He was nice, seemed attentive. 
Food was okay, nothing to write home about. My blackened chicken was flavorless, and not blackened. 
*Look at the bottom of your menu! They add 5% to your check to "cover the cost of working in San Francisco". Just beware. It's not worth it*
author: Kate O.

description: The food was definitely not worth the cost. The clam chowder on the warf was way better than the bowl here and gave a larger portion for less than half the price. The cioppino here was nothing compared to Phils fish market, the fish was dry and not flavorful at all. The mac nut mahi was absolutely disgusting and the worst mix of flavors. Definitely do not recommend.
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Wow tough.  Sat at the bar.  They are horrible.  Told him of my gluten allergy and shell fish, but yet the items they brought me were cross contamination.  Service was bad.   The piece fish of this I had was good, but they brought out out appetizer after  our main meal.  No one cares here.  To bad.  Great view horrible service.
author: Joe M.

description: Was hoping for seafood with an Italian twist as advertised....we got dry rigatoni and a spaghetti seafood plate that I couldn't eat. It listed "prawns, mussels, clams, and calamari. I actually got spaghetti with calamari tentacles. Overpriced, nothing unique. Blah...
author: Rob S.

description:
Great view of Alcatraz from our table. Mediocre food: 2 fish tacos were mostly shredded cabbage and half the plate was fries. Soups were lukewarm and were cold by the time the bread got to the table. Very slow service for an almost empty restaurant. 

Also the manager came up our table several times. We thought he was being attentive, but he was executing an upsell on a loyalty program that added $25 to our bill. 

Suggestion to the restaurant -- focus on service and the food and don't worry so much about selling loyalty programs. People will come back if the food and service are good. We won't be back to this or any other Chart House.
author: Marina C.

description: Our food was good and the view was stellar. :) I'm surprised that the reviews are not a bit better. Our food was fresh tasting and decently priced for the micro and macro location. We ordered the coconut shrimp appetizer (best of the meal), fish tacos, fish and chips, a Caesar salad (with balsamic--so good!), ahi sandwich, and a side of green beans. The ahi sandwich was a little over dressed but good quality. The fries are yummy. :)
author: J Michelle L.

description: Our lunch at this restaurant was memorable and delicious. It was an impulsive decision to come here and we did not have a reservation. The wait staff was very kind and gracious, and gave us a table with the best possible view of the bay, which we did not even request! The food was absolutely perfect, and the drinks were unique and very tasty. The waitress was very understanding that we were in a rush to get on the ferry for Alcatraz and brought all of our food out very quickly. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!
author: John L.

description: The food here almost made me throw up and it was way overpriced for its value. The waiting time was extremely long and had minimal payout. The best part was the view of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge, but still the food was terrible! I wouldn't come here again, but it may be worth it for the experience.
author: Megan N.

description: Food is good when you can get it, the view is outstanding.  The service while servers seem to be abundant, the only one that pays attention is a manager.  Waited 20 minutes upon sitting at the bar for someone to greet us, and needed to flag waiter to place food order from our table.
author: Jean-Paul G.

description:
We had our wedding reception at the Chart House. I was a little trepidatious because of some of the first Yelp reviews and the low stars, but I was sold by the brand new, renovated building, the sailor-chic decor, the incredible views, and the tasty food...so we did it. And boy am I glad we did.

Stanley, the catering manager, was a pleasure to work with. Chart House's pricing per person for both the food and the beverage packages was very competitive for San Francisco (especially the bar packages) and they let me decorate however I wanted, bring in a photo booth, DJ, dance floor, cream puffs, you name it-- no extra fees. 

Stanley was 100% up front about the cost and at the end of the night we paid exactly that. Our guests had a great time (especially marveling at the AMAZING views of the sea lions in their "natural" habitat, washed up on the docks right at the pier beneath our floor to ceiling windows!) We could hear them "laughing" right along with us as the toasts were made-- the view and the sounds that went along with it were just ridiculous and awesome. 

The food was very tasty! People cleaned their plates, and I would have if I could have too! (Somehow you're always being pulled in one direction or another when its your own wedding, huh.)

In short, the food was excellent, the decor and restaurant itself was beautiful and worth the slog through the otherwise tourist-trappy Pier 39, and the service was top notch. Whatever service issues the Chart House had when it first opened, they are more than ironed out under Stanley's leadership. 

Thank you Stanley and team for a great wedding reception! I'd do it again (but hopefully will never have to!)
author: Maya G.

description: Ate here tonight and it was a bit of a disappointment.  The views are great and the hostess was great but that was about it.  We sat at 615 and no one came by til we flagged someone down around 630.  At that point we ordered wine apps and main course all at the same time. 15 minutes later the waitress finally brought wine but she brought a Pinot Grigio not the Pinot Noir I ordered and then tried to tell me it was the noir.  Then she disappeared for another 15 minutes before returning and asking me which wine I ordered (3rd time).  Then the apps came and still no wine it had been about 45 min now.  We flagged down another server who brought the correct wine quickly then another 40 minutes wait for our entrees.  Food is ok - not bad by great.  I get it's the summer season and all but the lack of training was really bad.  The manager was always walking around busy but never came by even though we were there for 2 hours.
author: Ameri R.

description: The food and drinks were great our family enjoyed it. The service was alright. Had to ask to refill tea a few times. Otherwise would definetly come back and recommend it. Beautiful views just like everyone says.
author: Veronika G.

description: I brought friends from out of town here for lunch today. The ambiance is beautiful as well as spectacular views. However, our sever had 0 personality, we felt like it was his first day on the job. 2/3 of us are in the service industry so we are more understanding than most. 1 scallop on the seafood pasta, and only tonic when we ordered a double vodka. When you're spending $50 a person at lunch I expect hospitality- not mediocre service. Honestly. We had amazing views and better service at Applebee's down the street! I don't think we will be back. If we had excellent service it would've been worth the money
author: Aundria L.

description:
Service was great, efficient , nice, cheerful
My  french dip  was up there with the best.
None of the poor review experience at all
Give it a try...
author: Angela C.

description:
I'm only giving this place a star because of the awesome view and great seat we got. Other than that it's NOT WORTH IT. (This was my birthday dinner, keep in mind)

Everything started off fine and I was excited because of the awesome seat we got. Our waiter came and then before even taking my boyfriend and my drink order he reached over us and grabbed the extra silverware on the table. Without being too direct, this is where we discovered that his hygiene was subpar. From this point on every time he came over to the table he kept reaching over our drinks and appetizers and it wasn't appetizing. The appetizers were okay: Calamari (too much sauce) , lobster bisque (I've had way better but wasn't horrible, just not great). 

Since we were planning on getting sweets at Fisherman's Wharf afterwards we both decided to share the Prime Rib dinner and added on the bacon Brussel sprouts. After we finished our appetizers we waited for our ONE entre. And waited. And waited. Waited.... After 35 minutes the food finally came out. At first sight I was disappointed to put it politely. For a $45 meal, it was COLD, undercooked and didn't look at all like what a nice restaurant would consider acceptable to serve. The Brussel sprouts looked like the came from a can or were boiled and they just three some bacon on it, no seasoning.... It was terrible to put it short. 

Finally once the waiter came to check on us, I was able to tell him we were going to pass on the meal and just take our check. He didn't say sorry, he didn't ask what was wrong, or how he could make it right. He just grabbed the plates and left for the check. Upon returning the check, he just dropped it off at the table and kept walking by briskly. Since he wasn't apologetic at this point that just got both of us frustrated and he lost the chance of a decent tip because of his bad attitude. I have nothing more to say about this place.... Just don't go.
author: Sethia D.

description:
Had reservations for thanksgiving, the hostess was ok, was greeted but she didn't really bother to look up from what she was doing. Granted, it did look like they were busy, but the job as the hostess is to greet right? They may have been understaffed due to it being thanksgiving, and I felt like our waiter did his job fine, but seemed like he didn't want t to be there.  
Lobster Mac and cheese- not very flavorful and not very cheesy
Turkey dinner- good
Prime rib- it was ok 

Three stars based on service and price (thought service should have been better for the price for the food)
author: Merry L.

description: My boyfriend and our son stopped here for dinner. When they learned we were celebrating a birthday, they set us at a table with an amazing view. We were able to watch the sunset. The guys ordered a seafood special and I ordered pasta. The food was all great. Our waitress was very sweet and offered us a mud pie as a birthday treat along with the lava cake we ordered for dessert.
author: Kristi S.

description: I loved the food, it was so good and cooked very well. The view of the Bay is amazing and the staff is nice. It is expensive but well worth it!
author: Alexandria C.

description:
Awesome location to dine - on a clear day you'd have the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz as your backdrop. Consider that before griping about the price, which is posted with the menu outside.

We ordered the avocado, mango, crab stack and I was kind of disappointed to see that the avocado was really gray/bruised. You would think in California they could find a fresh avocado. 

We then ordered the fish n chips and the BBQ burger, and I must admit they were pretty great. Something about the batter on the fish n chips was different from other places, in a really good way.

The waitress we had (Shayna) was attentive and really nice too.
author: Vic M.

description: Everything people say about the service is sadly TRUE. 25 minutes before we even saw a waiter. No water, no hello, no nothing. 6pm, don't know what they would do if they were actually busy. I think this place needs a new manager. People dead of thirst at the bar
author: Susie R.

description: This place is a month old folks, every restaurant has to work out the kinks. What a bunch babies! This place use to be Neptunes it's now the new remodeled Chart House. Welcome! They did a great job! Cool bar , very nice lay out. Friendly hostess up front. My sister and I snacked at the bar. My Blood Orange Margarita was perfect. Our server and everyone working today was helpful and friendly 3/18/26 thank you!
author: Cecilia D.

description: To begin,  I would say that the drinks are delicious.  So go straight to the bar,  sit down,  and enjoy yourself.  But we didn't do that.  We came in for lunch.  We ordered the crabmeat stacker and poke appetizers.  I had the crabmeat melt and my girlfriend had the lobster bisque.  She liked the lobster bisque.  The poke was okay,  we've had better but it was okay.  The presentation was very nice.   They failed to use lump crabmeat on either the crabmeat stacker nor the crabmeat melt. The melt looked like crap.  It tasted good,  but then it's hard to mess up shredded crabmeat on toast covered with cheese.  Coming from Baltimore,  we're used to lump crabmeat.  Especially at these price points.  The avocado layer of the stacker wasn't diced fine enough,  so you had to cut it further.  The mango layer was flavorless,  and the crabmeat layer was a flavorless shredded mess with small shrimp that were easy to miss.  If it wasn't for the great service, view,  and drinks,  this place would've only gotten one star.
author: Michael P.

description: It's all about the Bay views. Go for lunch or early dinner. Get a table by the windows. Service and food are OK, but nothing special.
author: Michael H.

description: Food was excellent. Salmon was cooked beautifully. Medium prime rib was perfectly medium. Server Calvin awesome!  He was attentive and pleasant.  -1 star because all surrounding tables were provided bread, and we were not. I hope it wasn't because of our laid back clothing. I'd return just for the amazing view, and to give them a chance to redeem themselves for the no bread discrimination!
author: miranda c.

description:
Awful service with a great view.  Myself and 2 friends went here for a quick drink on Saturday before 3pm.  We sat in the bar area and were quite unhappy with the service.  No one checked on us, we asked several times for a water refill and never got it.  I will not be returning here. I have literally never tipped less than 18% even w/ crummy service, but I did this time. 
Also, they don't list the prices of drinks on their menu, which I don't enjoy.  
Bathrooms were clean.
author: Natalie F.

description: Beautiful location and large restaurant. We came on a Wednesday evening 40 minutes before sunset. Hostess told us if we wanted a window seat it would be a 10 minute wait. We sat in the bar which had a beautiful view of the ocean but not of the sunset and ordered a bottle of wine. Meanwhile,there were several open tables next to the window and after about 25 minutes and the sun was setting I asked about the table. She told me that they were under staffed and could not seat us any earlier. At 45 min into us waiting our table was ready. We decided to stay in the bar area. When the server brought the menus we asked what he would order. He gave us a rehearsed menu breakdown....we asked him what his favorite was he told us the most expensive item on the menu. Needless to say, we enjoyed our bottle of wine and moved on.
author: Casandra H.

description: Yum! Came here for happy hour during my stay in SF. It is at the end of Pier 39 and has some wonderful views of the bay, you can see Alcatraz too. The happy hour menu included items from $6-9, the roast beef sliders were incredible! I also tried the lobster bisque and the hummus plate which were just as yummy. The bartenders and the hostess were very pleasant and friendly. I would definitely come back for dinner!!!
author: Christine P.

description: Very good service and food. A nice place for dinner with good ambience and a relaxing atmosphere. I would definitely go back.
author: Nancy W.

description: This is typical  restaurant chain fare with prices consistent with the location. Great view and location, but the food is high priced and just average. I've eaten at their other locations with much better service and food quality. Considering their local competition, they need to step up the service and food quality.
author: Earl S.

description: Do not waste your money- Go to Fog Harbor Fish house instead- we ate at both. Chart house served oysters that were not freshly shucked and shucked improperly-still attached to the shell. The green beans were not prepped and had stems on them. There is a reason they had empty tables and open reservation times!!! The great waiter was the only reason it received two stars
author: N A.

description:
Fantastic service, great food, and pretty view of the water. Our server was extremely gracious and took great care of our food prep including attention to allergies. 

The mood of the restaurant is really neat - classy.
author: Zac N.

description:
I was a bit underwhelmed by this experience. On one hand, the service was fantastic. From the front staff to the wait staff, that was all flawless. However...

The food was underwhelming, to say the least.

Listen, if you're going to do your own take on a caprese salad, at least TRY and do it some justice. If you're looking at getting one here, avoid it. Buffalo mozzarella? Nope. Shaved parmesan. Tomatoes? 3-4 cherry tomatoes. The vinaigrette was indeed very tasty, but the chicken that came with it (oh, yes, I forgot to mention, this was a chicken caprese salad) was overcooked and way too chewy...and tasted slightly burned?).

Two of these orders came out for myself and another guest, we both received the same thing. We were comped 2 drinks which was a bit of a let down, but what can I say, it was better than nothing.

All in all, it was (from my meal perspective) overpriced, overthought, and deconstructed in a highly (yet poorly) pretentious way.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
If you are looking for the tasty dish in San Francisco, this place is not the one you should go.
The view from the restaurant was beautiful and I loved it, but this is the first and last positive statement from me about this restaurant.

I went to dinner with one of my ex-colleagues and current colleague, we expected to have a nice seafood. As a concierge of the hotel (park55) recommended this place so we came here.
We ordered;
A glass of local sauvignon blanc(dry, very good one)
Coconut shrimp(it was heavy. Not great)
Oysters(good!)
Ribbon salad(it was ok)
Dungeness crab (the worst crab ever)
Lava cake(it was complimentary)

I heard that the coconut shrimp is one of their signature, and it was not very good. It was tasteless. The crab was surprisingly tasteless, and the meat of the crab was dried. It was no good.
Regardless of the quality of the dishes and poor and late service, I think It was pricey.

I will never use this restaurant.
author: May T.

description: So... I don't normally go to the city the to the traffic and horrible parking. But I braved the opposition for the hell of it. Ended up at this place because every other restaurant was packed. The atmosphere was pleasant and low key. Must of the customers were tourists and middle age to elderly people. Anyways the prices were pretty high but it a shot. We waited roughly 30 mins for a table. Again it was pretty busy because of today being black Friday. Anyways after we were seated it took another 20 minutes before the waiter walked by and side "I will be right with you in a moment"  a few minutes passed by and then took our order. I order a French dip  and a bowl of lobster  bisque and my wife had a Dungeness crab melt and a bowl of chowder. Well... the soup was great the French dip did come with the Monterey cheese and the meat was dryer than than the bread itself. For $16.50 for a French dip it would have some sort of sauce atleast mayo and the meat would be juicy. And the crab melt came with no top bread... just the bottom piece of bread. When it came to the service.. We were at the table for atleast 1.5 hours and the server came only twice without looking for him and flagging him down... He took our order and asked about the food. That was it. In had to ask for the refills  on mybwifes coke which was $4.00 and we had to ask for the check and he didn't ask about desert. For a total bill of $66.00 and shitty service and crappy food...I will definitely will not come back. My wife wanted to leave a $10.00 tip and I told her hell no. But she left a $10.00 bill for him. I said $5.00. Yes it is a small tip but I am leaving money for "TIP'S" which stand for To Insure Prompt Sevice... and we do not receive that.
author: Mike D.

description:
My coworker and I had a long day of meetings and decided to reward ourselves with a nice meal at Chart House. 

They were very busy and understandably doing the best they could to ensure we had a quality experience. One of the managers Karen came by our table to ensure we were enjoying our visit. 

We started with Lobster bisque soup and clam chowder which was delicious. I had the Prime rib melt which literally melted in my mouth (highly recommend this).  

Always a great meal at Chart house.
author: Carlos M.

description:
Lobsters...bisque...was fantastic...only thing about it
