Was I ordered the large bowl. It fooled our table so bad we couldn't stop laughing on yhe size of the baby Calderon it was served in. It had to be a cup and a half of soup for the price...everything else was delicious....
author: Ilima J.

description: My wife and I just had an amazing dinner here. The view is amazing as expected, but the food was also fantastic and the service was top tier. In particular our server Linda was great, and the manager was very attentive as well. We were celebrating our anniversary and they really made it a special night for us!
author: Jared T.

description: Came here for my Birthday dinner, I'm from out of town and I was so excited for this dinner. I'm a waitress, I also manage at the restaurant I work at have for 6 years. I'm 26 and me and my boyfriend had reservations. We were taken right in, sat at a beautiful table with a view. Breath taking. Yet we sat there for at least 10 mins without once person greeting or asking for our drinks. Once waiter came to the table just said hello did not introduce himself and didn't even ask us if we were celebrating anything, nice restaurants should be doing those simple things to make the experience better. We ordered drinks an yet for a beer and cocktail it took another 10mins, yet I understand getting busy and the bartender getting slammed, yet it was not packed in there. We ordered appetizer and it came fairly quickly, our food followed after and it was excellent and delicious. We were only checked on once and the only other time was what I think was the general manager, was very friendly which I wish our waiter was like. Yet I watched this manager go around and make small talk, some times making jokes super nice guy. Got to our table and asked one question and moved on. I don't mind this, yet the whole time I was there I felt as though, cause I was on the younger side of the crowd they felt they could kind of ignore us. Offered dessert but by that time I was over it, go here for the view and food, don't expect much from service. I'm being nice too cause I'm a server myself. All in all ok experience.
author: Sarah H.

description: Not sure why the reviews are bad. The drinks were good. The food was very good. Service at the host  station, bar and waitress was great. Expensive but you are in San Francisco in a tourist area. Over looked the bay at sunset. Very nice.
author: Tammi B.

description:
We were so excited to go to the Chart House on Pier 39 for our date night away from the kids. I've been a big fan of Chart House Restaurants for years and was very disappointed when they closed the Chart House's in Half-moon Bay and Maui. When I found a new Chart House I could not wait for the opportunity to share the Chart House dining experience with my wife.

The restaurant is beautiful with classic ambiance and an amazing view. Unfortunately, that's the last positive statement I can make regarding this restaurant.  We were seated at a Bay front table and waited for about fifteen minutes before our waiter bothered to stop by our table. We ordered drinks, Diet Pepsi a Lemon Drop and the Coconut Crunchy Shrimp and Crab, Shrimp, Avocado & Mango Stack for starters. At the same time, we asked for a basket of bread. TWENTY minutes went by before we received our drinks and another twelve minutes before the appetizers came. Ok, so a small point, The restaurant is in San Francisco; one would expect fresh crab and shrimp. Nope, the Crab, Shrimp, Avocado & Mango Stack was loaded with raw red onions and canned crab and frozen shrimp. The Coconut Crunchy Shrimp was actually good. Thank heavens because the rest of the meal was almost inedible. Both my wife and I started with the clam chowder which as very watery with little pieces of potato and clams. I don't know whether they make it fresh but canned soup is better. I'm used to creamy clam chowder with big pieces of potato and clams you can actually see. I could not bring myself to finish the soup.  At this point we should have left, but it was date night and I was enjoying the company of my beautiful wife. During our soup debacle, and after asking three times, the bread appeared! Again, this is San Francisco; sour dough bread is expected in restaurants by the water. Again, nope the breadbasket was filled with rolls, which most likely came from a Costco type bakery. Not even warmed much less freshly baked. It was evident why the restaurant was half-empty on a Friday night.  For my main dish, I ordered the Captains Cut of Prime and my wife ordered Prime Rib but asked for an end cut (she is not a fan of medium temperature meat). Reservations were for 6:15 and we were seated at 6:25, our main course did not make it to the table until 7:50. Yep, an hour and twenty-five minutes enduring frozen shrimp and watery clam chowder before our main course meal was served. It only gets worse, pictures attached. When my Prime Rib was served it initially looked as if it might actually be good, well if you ignore the flab of fat almost as large as the cut of meat. Then, I took a bite and realized that the cut of meat was reheated on a grill, including grill marks. The meat was tough, and dry. My wife's cut of meat was just disgusting; an end cut is supposed to be a well done cut from the end side of the prime rib. Her cut was a large lump of gray-brown something and from who knows where staring back at her from the plate. We called our waiter over and when he found the time to visit our table offered to take one of the clam chowders off our bill. We asked for the manager and she did take my wife's dinner off the bill but left the clam chowder on the bill. They say a picture is worth a thousand words, check these out!

I had such high expectations for this Chart House, and I'm truly amazed at how disappointing our experience turned out. To sum up, great view, great ambiance, terrible service, and really, really bad food.
author: Thomas E.

description: Very few patrons in bar....still no one approached us at our table.  Finally ordered from bar.   Then bartender took off to clean tables and remembered our order after another person finally asked if we had been helped.  Not the service I expected from Chart House.
author: Jim T.

description: The reviews are spot on! The service started out great until we placed our orders. We waited an incredibly long time to be served and once the food arrived, we had to send it all back! My seared ahi tuna was cooked through and the replacement was almost the same. I asked our server Ashley for the manager and she sends out a very combative kitchen manager Melissa, who proceeds to tell me the order was put in for medium-well tuna. Are you kidding me? It was ordered seared twice! She offered to make me a third one and I kindly declined. "Are you sure?" she asked "because I don't see you eating!" Well, I usually don't pile food in my mouth when speaking... She then proceeds to tell my husband that the filet mignon he sent back was almost medium rare (more like medium well) in a chastising tone. Almost medium rare is not what he ordered. Our daughter's sea bass was so undercooked, it was gelatinous. Finally, restaurant manager (not the angry kitchen manager) approached our table and offered us dessert on the house as compensation. He returns 20 minutes later to ask how the dessert was... we tell him our server Ashley never stopped by after we asked for the manager, and that we have been waiting for water for almost an hour and our dessert. He tells us that's bc he's taken over for her. Wonderful.. so he should have known we never got the dessert. We just all stared at each other in disbelief. At that point, we opted to just leave and get dessert elsewhere. Worst Chart House experience EVER!! On the bright side, the views were spectacular and we enjoyed the rest of stay in San Francisco!
author: Cristina R.

description: The best seafood. I had the Ahi tacos, never seen a dish like it. Served w tempura type taco shells, shredded cabbage, avocados slices & sliced Ahi. So good. Great view of the bay. Best mojito ever. Will go again.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Friday there for dinner.
the lady at the front desk is very nice and helpful.
however, the dining experience just horrible...
4 people for $250...
come on, it's chart house .....
waiters just dropped the dishes then left each time...
we had to arrange space, clean table -- all by ourselves....
kinda to beg passing by waiters to pick up the empty plates and missing forks.
when we finally went for the main dishes... all cold already.
busy hour that time??.... NO ....
so no more Chart House ...... totally disappointed.
author: Yumi H.

description:
If you are looking for a great seafood restaurant around the wharf, I highly suggest the nearby Blue Mermaid on Jefferson St b/t Hyde St & Leavenworth St.

I am with most the other reviewers on this site, being a SF local, I will not be coming back here as the service is beyond unexceptionable for a SF restaurant.   I really feel bad for tourists that stumble on this place.  We were often left with the feeling they only cared to fill seats with tourist that are just passing through rather than making a loyal customers for life. 

Let me first start out by saying when the food finally got to our table, everyones dish was extremely memorable although we waited so long for it to come we were still so hungry we ended up stoping at a street vendor for a snack. 

After being seated it took over 20 min for someone to come to our table just to tell us our server would be with us shortly!?!  (WTF, after 20 min can you please define shortly - how about some bringing us some water at least).  Finally after another 10 min one server came and took our drink order.   It would be another 20 min before he came back to take our food order and another 30 min for the food to actually come out.  During the course of our meal, our sever changed so many times, we had no idea who our server really was.  

As I said, the food was very memorable which is why I gave this place 2 stars.  However, in my option, you are paying for the amazing view of the bay at this place and that's about it.
author: Eric C.

description:
Was empty when we walked in. Should have been a warning since everywhere else was busy. We got a seat and waited close to 15 minutes, still no server so we left. 
They were stood around talking and the ones moving did their best to avoid customer eye contact
author: Tony B.

description: Came here for drinks and appetizers with out of two family. Waited 15 minutes before we had to flag someone down to place a drink order. Waited another 20 minutes before half our table got their drinks. Another almost 10 before we got ours. The two stars are for the drinks- we got the mojito flight and it was a great choice. Service just really bad - poorly managed
author: Matthew S.

description: I would love to give CH 5 stars but the food is seriously lacking.  The service was decent, no complaints there, the view was spectacular,  the support staff and management were very nice.  The food was very disappointing, my Dad had the fried fish platter and it was served cold.  It didn't look appetizing either.  My Mom had the swordfish, it was undercooked.  My parents hate sending food back or making a fuss so they ate it.  My partner had the prime rib topped with a mix of seafood and crab.  it looked really good and the temp was ok but sadly it lacked any real flavor.  I had the mac nut mahi, it was cooked ok and had ok flavor but it wasn't anything exciting.  Our starter soups were good, we had both kinds, but were not hot at all.  If my parents hadn't gone to Alcatraz earlier, I would've chosen another restaurant that had better food, but this touristy location was ideal for them so they didn't have to walk far.  I would not eat here again.
author: Ivan The Terrible 6.

description: Worst customer service ever. Refused to honor a reservation through OpenTable and front desk staff was extremely rude and manager was also very rude. Refused to seat our family with a reservation and the restaurant was not even full.
author: Lottie K.

description: I had dinner here with my husband & daughter for the first time. The service was great & the food was delicious! They were also very accommodating to our daughter who's 6 months pregnant. Amazing view also!
author: Marie A.

description: I went here with my Grandma and Mom while on a Mother's Day vacation. We stopped in for lunch after a long day sightseeing and shopping and we were greeted with a smile and told that we could be seated right away or if we wanted a window, which we did, that we could wait 15 minutes. It ended up being more like 5 minutes and we were brought over to a BEAUTIFUL view. We could see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge with nothing in the way. We were then promptly greeted by our server and given menus and our water glasses were filled. We ordered the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and it was amazing. We ordered more horseradish because we like our cocktail sauce a bit hotter than they make it...think St. Elmo's. My Grandma and I split the beer battered fish and chips and it was delicious. The fries were perfectly done and the fish was flakey and flavorful and fried to perfection. The tartar sauce was super yummy. My Mom got the coconut shrimp and said it was really great. The coconut sauce was her favorite. My grandma also got the lobster bisque and said it was one of the better ones she has had. Overall this place was a good place to stop after a day of sightseeing for some yummy seafood and friendly workers.
author: Kirsten K.

description: Great food and view! The service was ok in the bar section, but once we sat at our table service was decent.
author: Shokoufeh A.

description: Poor service! Horrible company that runs this restaurant. I see managers who treat their employees like garbage. I could go on, but it's not worth my time or energy!
author: Matt R.

description:
Chart House was not only disappointing in customer service, but also in food. First of all, the restaurant was not well lit at all. There were two candles on our table and a dimly lit ceiling light far away from the table, leaving us in mostly dark at 8:30 at night. The waiter was rude, had bad breath, and pushed each member of our party to order an extra side or dessert without telling us the price beforehand. I ordered a bread bowl with clam chowder- the bread was hard and felt stale, both the clam chowder and bread bowl were not warm (soup should be hot!), and the clam chowder smelled very fishy, which usually means the ingredients weren't that fresh. 

The only redeeming quality was their garlic cheese bread- very good.
author: Kelly Y.

description: I've dined at the Charthouse in Melbourne, FL and Savannah, GA and this was by far the most disappointing location. My husband liked the clams, and the coconut shrimps were... Coconut shrimp. But his seafood pasta was unremarkable and my beef was overcooked (in fact they didn't even ask how I wanted it cooked) and I didn't even try finishing it. To be fair, we were there for the view (which is spectacular). But we'd have loved to order more wine/drinks and our glasses sat empty for far too long on a day where they were far overstuffed for a holiday. Inconsistent service and unremarkable food in a place where there are many options. Come for the view but don't anticipate the "high end" they advertise.
author: Shaz P.

description:
Friendly service and delicious meal. "Meh" serving size dessert.

Our waitress was a friendly girl from Ireland who seemed to enjoy her job. We got the Kim Cheer Calamari which was delicious and huge. The lobster bisque and clam chowder definitely didn't disappoint. Also, we would definitely recommend the prime rib sandwhich which comes with a ton of fries. Service was fast and accomodating.

We were a little disappointed with the size of their chocolate lava cake, which had been very much hyped up, especially for its price. It takes at least 30 minutes to make. While the cake and ice cream are rich and delicious, ours came a little cold (the hot cake) and the ice cream a little melted.
author: Mary S.

description: In town from Dallas, Texas for the Cowboy/49er game, did not check Yelp (my bad), but landed at Chart House. HORRIBLE all the way around, from what I was told regarding wait time for a table, to service at the bar (15 minutes before anyone even looked our way) to quality of food. Has to be better choices on the Pier
author: Jay S.

description: Beautiful view.  Bad service.  Food mediocre.  Manager very nice & helpful, but he had to be our waiter because our service was so poor.  Ate at bar & bartender ignored us for a full hour.  Tossed some napkins our way.
author: Malia G.

description: I can't say enough good things about our experience! The staff was amazing, the food was delicious and they were very efficient! We were in the banquet room with a very large party.  Everyone in our group commented about our wonderful experience! Thank you to everyone who made our evening enjoyable!
author: Amy K.

description:
The restaurant had such an opportunity to receive 3 or even 4 stars from me, but it's the little things that they did, or didn't do, that in my mind justifies just 2 stars.  Traveled to SF this past Sunday night with family in from out of town, and we thought it might be nice to capture a sunset type dinner from Pier 39, given that one person in the group had never been to SF before. Pier 39 was crazy busy, even for Sept 17th. We walked up to a few of the restaurants, and 1 had the nerve to say there was a 2 hour way (even with plenty of open tables). In the end, we saw the Chart House, it appeared somewhat empty, and we had high hopes. 
We were told by the rather not so nice hostess there would be a 25 minute wait. We said OK. But then after sitting on the sofa, I noticed there were about 20 open tables. I asked if we could be seated there, and she said they didn't have a server for that section. We eventually asked if we could go wait at the high top tables, and were told we could, and we were even brought menus. After waiting for about 10 minutes, the waiter who was nice enough came over and eventually took our drink and dinner order. About 5 minutes later the hostess came over and said our table was ready. We said we just ordered from the waiter, and she said that was unfortunate, because we could now NOT get seated at our table since we had officially ordered from the High Tops in the Bar Area. Really. Like we're supposed to know there internal rules.  By the way, there were 2 open tables just feet from where we were sitting down on the main floor level that eventually got filled, but a good 30 minutes into our time while there. So why couldn't we have just been seated there in the very beginning.

Eventually our salads were brought out, and one of them had the wrong dressing, while the other was the wrong salad altogether.

Then the entrees came, and the person delivering the food says "Who gets the pasta?  Who gets the salmon".  you get the idea. For a restaurant charging these prices, would be nice if they put a bit more effort into the entire process. 

The food was OK. But once again, just a bit more effort on management's part to really not just view the patrons as a once and done prospect would have gone a long way into getting a 3 to 4 star review. The location itself is amazing. They really need to view the dining experience through the customer's eyes as what happens from the moment they walk through the door until they leave. I would not go back, or if I did, I'd put in a reservation to ensure that I got seated on the main part of the floor and without a wait.
author: Roger S.

description: The food was delicious, but the service was very poor.  It took much longer to be seated than they originally told us, drinks at the bar took a silly amount of time, and our appetizers / food took a very very long time.  The view is the only reason this is a 2 star review and not a 1.
author: Alison H.

description: The view is spectacular. It's the reason to eat there. My husband got the hamburger which he described as "cooked perfectly with good flavor."  My daughter and I both had the chicken BLT sandwich which was tasty. The service was exceedingly slow, even though many tables were empty. The prices are high but you're really paying for the view.
author: Deborah G.

description: So disappointed in the experience I had there. The kitchen cooked everyone's food but mine. The waiter brought out everyone's food and told me they packed up the entree I ordered already so basically I was getting dinner. By the time the the food came out it was after 10 so it was too late to order something else. All the waiter said was I'll make sure to take the charge off the bill. I was so hungry so my friend gave me their mashed potatoes. This was just one of MANY poor customer service disappointments we experienced with our dinner here.
author: Dana D.

description:
SAVE YOUR MONEY!  DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!    Had some friends in town and we were out n about and decided to grab some food here since we've eaten at the Chart House in Miami before and enjoyed it.  We were definitely mistaken.   

The food left all of us with tummy aches that evening.  We all had different items: artichoke appetizer, coconut shrimp, crab cake, clam chowder, chopped spinach salad, crab melt sandwich, and the kids chicken tenders for my friend's son.  Two of us shared a bottle of wine and the other had an old fashioned.   We tried to figure out if we all ate/drank the same stuff but we didn't.  Everyone ended up with weird stomachs later that evening.  My guess is that the food prep was not hygienic which is super scary.  

Service...not too hot either.  From the moment we walked in the door it was piss poor.  There were four hostesses staring at us and I asked for a table for four.  Her response was, 'For dinner?  Can I get a name?' Our name was taken and the we were immediately seated.....?????  I thought you only needed a name during a wait?????  Next, our server was aloof; barely around, seemed hassled to even be waiting on us and forgot food items that we had ordered.  Not sure if he was vaped out, hating his job or both.  

I've been working in the service industry a very long time.  It's super disappointing to experience such terrible service, get a stomach ache from the food and all the while spend a decent dollar amount on food.   Seriously folks, I do not recommend this place at all.  Save yourself the stomach ache and money.  Go eat elsewhere.
author: Bojangles O.

description: This place sucks. They don't deserve a star.  We reserved ten days in advance. We arrived at our time and then they told us to wait for one hour and a half because they did not have our table. A lot of people had the same problem. I went inside and some people were complaining about the food and some had been waiting for an hour and did not received their food. Shame on this place. Don't come here! Restrooms were OK. But terrible at the same time
author: Rafael V.

description:
What a fantastic lunch at the Chart House at Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf San Fransisco CA. I brought my relatives from Ohio and West Virginia to see my daughter who is attending college. 
We ordered Clam Chowder Soup, Fish and Chips, Coconut Shrimp, and a Cheeseburger ~ all served with French fries. Delicious bread and butter with our meal. 
Broderick seated us by the window and we had a fantastic view of Alcatraz  
We enjoyed the many boats and Seals in the water. 
We will definitely be back. 
Thank you Michael for being such a great Waiter. 
C. Lovejoy
San Diego, CA. 
9/13/16
author: Carol L.

description: Wanted to take my mom for a nice lunch with a view... hostess told us there were no tables next to the window even though there was 2 empty tables next to the window and an entire section open next to windows. I understand there are certain sections for servers, but literally as we sat down they opened the new section by the window and then proceeded to seat 2 other (2 person parties) next to the window where we requested. We sat for a while as serves walked right passed us not even acknowledging us. I finally requested a manager (after both my mother and I went to the restroom separately and no one had still come by)and as he seemed annoyed we were bringing this to his attention he asked how HE could be of service to us. All I wanted was water... food was par, service needs to be improved.
author: Brittney N.

description: Came in here the other day and was greeted by a friendly young woman; so far so good. Checked in and the table I was going to get was dirty, so the young woman that greeted me was told (by, I'm assuming, the manager,) to go bus the table and reset it. Obviously not having any experience bussing, she was struggling to get everything off the table, and didn't know what to do with the dirty dishes. At this point, you would assume the manager, or another busser, or any other employee would help, but no. I watched as the manager and the other hostess laughed and snickered as she struggled to prepare the table. It was a disgusting display to watch, and I was completely shocked that an employee could be treated so unfairly, especially by a manager (who is supposed to be there to help everyone). The food was alright, portion sizes were fairly small. After I had finished, I went up to speak to the young woman, who's name is Mimi. I told her I had witnessed the situation with the table needing to be bussed and reset, and her response was "Oh, it's alright, it happens a lot to me here". At this point I was speechless. I urged her to talk to Human Resources, because treatment like that, in the workplace especially, is unacceptable. Definitely will not be coming back here again, and I sure hope that woman leaves this place for somewhere better.
author: Mason G.

description:
My second visit to Chart House on Monday, 06/27/16 was horrible.   The waitress never brought menus, silverware, or cleaned the table.  My appetizer never came and my fiancé' entree was already finished and still no appetizer.

I will never attempt to dine in this restaurant again.  The management and servers are awful.  I highly suggest getting their entire team retrained on customer service since they have no idea what they are doing.
author: Neil A.

description:
The food was okay.
The wait was atrocious.
We visited this establishment a few months ago, and also had the same slow service.  We thought we'd give this restaurant a second chance last Saturday.  We had 6 p.m. reservations, and had to wait over 10 minutes to be seated.  It took the waitress over 45 minutes to take our dinner order.  We waited another 50 minutes before our entrees arrived, and that's because I spoke to the staff, including the manager, inquiring about when our dinner would arrive.  I do enjoy leisure dining, but a three hour dinner is too long.

If you have all the time in the world, then this place will work out for you.
author: Patricia L.

description: So let me start by saying the staff is nice and friendly, BUT everything that came out was COLD! None of the food was hot and it was very disappointing. The food was under seasoned and overall just below average. Also my husband ordered the prime rib and it was horrible! The seasoning was bad, the manager was going to "help" but did NOTHING!!! Literally horrible !! Only reason I'm giving one star is because of our waiter Conner, other than that please DONT come!! Great potential of a place but honestly not so good food.
author: Yani G.

description: Went here for drinks and everyone was very nice but the bartender took forever and never even checked back. The drinks were good so we decided to come back for dinner despite the bartender. We made a reservation just in case and when we came back got a sarcastic greeting about our reservation that we had a "VIP" table. We were seated and NEVER checked back with. The restaurant was not busy, the waiter checked on the tables around us twice and never looked our way. My mom got up to go to the bathroom, made eye contact with him and still nothing. She got back from the bathroom and still we were never even spoken to, so of course we left.
author: Rochelle S.

description: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!! So my husband and I are here for our New Years Eve/anniversary dinner and have been waiting for almost an hour for our food. Also waited about 20 minutes to be asked if we wanted anything to drink. I really hope the food is worth the wait
author: Emily R.

description:
The food was great don't get me wrong... But this review is for the service staff. The actual service was not bad, very attentive, but we felt SEVERELY JUDGED.  
My boyfriend and I are in our late 20's, had made a spontaneous trip to SF and decided to have a nice lunch with a view. We weren't expecting to have a nice lunch so we were in normal every day clothes, jeans, shorts, t shirts and hats. 
Restaurant is cute and the views were great. What ruined our experience though, was our hostess and server. They looked at us as if we were a couple of kids not going to pay our bill. We ordered wine, beer, apps, and food. Lunch was almost $100 and we tipped over 20% (on top of that ridiculous SF food tax). Our server practically ran to the table after we got up to leave to make sure we paid.
We have both served before and understand server concerns, but to leave us feeling that way after leaving was not cool... Wishing we would have tipped less now.
author: Katie T.

description: Came tonight for my daughters 21st birthday. Drinks were great! No complaints and we had quite a few different ones. Calamari and coconut shrimp was also very good. Seafood pasta was horrible. Shrimp and scallops were very over cooked. Crab melt very good and fresh tasting. The best part was Calvin our server. Very nice young man. Spoke well, attentive, and got all 13 orders out perfect! (It wasn't his fault the seafood Pasta was yuck!) I would come again and have my dinner and drinks all over again.
author: Dina D.

description: Was not my first choice, but my wife wanted clam chowder. The service started very slow but the dining manager came around and it was a marked improvement. The food was solid but not great. I had fish and chips which was safe and decent. Wife had clam chowder which she said tastes fresh and home cooked.
author: Rob L.

description: Spent $300.00 here last night including tip. And it's not that the food was bad or the customer service was horrible, it's that the food was not $300 food. I could have seen paying $175-$200, but I just was not that impressed. I was happy they got us right in and sat us right down. Then after we sat down, we waited and waited. To get our check I had to wave somebody down to get the check. Just not thoroughly impressed by this place.
author: Kevin M.

description: We had reservation for our New Year 2017 dinner. We reserved a table for 12/31/16 at 10:15 pm days ahead. We drove over 100 miles to find out that they had one and half hour to two hour schedule delay! They only said "sorry". No solution was given but wait. Fee charge if the reservation was cancelled. Worse experience! Never make reservations there.
author: Daniel V.

description: We went only because I wanted somewhere nice to sit and overlook the bay. The hostess was nice, the server was friendly and the food was average. Didn't taste fresh. Wasn't the worst I've ever had but no where near what you would expect for a fancy restaurant with a great view. They could be so great, just missing a few things.
author: Kristi O.

description:
Ordered seafood fried platter. 

Calamari and fries on the platter were cold, the fish and coconut shrimp were in room temperature. I asked the waiter to refute another plate, and within five minutes later, it came back. 

It was not refuted, rather it was REFRIED. After the second round of frying, the food were soggy and exceptionally greasy. 

One star for the food and one more star for the service which was not bad.
author: Andy D.

description: This place gets 2 stars for the view, which is its best feature.  Nothing came out as stated on the menu. Appetizer came with entrees.  One of the entrees was 7 minutes later than the others and was wrong.  The food was mediocre and the service practically non-existent.  When the sun sets they don't have shades so you have sun in your eyes for the entirety of your high priced meal.  2 people got sick.  Avoid this tourist trap.
author: Barbara T.

description:
Lovely place! Our server was very good and the food we ordered were all good. Calamari &  coconut shrimps for appetizer (Excellent), Mac Mahi Mahi  (Excellent), Seafood pasta (Excellent). I know people are thinking of 5 star service,  we didn't get if perfectly but close. The lava cake was really good.  
It was my 50th birhtday and the Chart House made it memorable. 
I've been to several Chart House restaurants and I would say, this place will get better and better . Remember,  you are dining in one of the most busiest city in the world!  Expect some delays in service. Don't be too picky. Enjoy the view!
author: Betty R.

description: Very Disappointing.  I have dined at the Chart House in Monterey several times and was delighted by the experience.  Therefore I was excited when I heard there was a Chart House in San Francisco.  Very disappointed as several of the menu items I enjoyed were not available.  I was especially disappointed that there was no salad bar, which is one of the reasons I love this restaurant.  I will definitely not return.
author: Christina G.

description: The 10 min wait when no one was there ended up being 25+ mins. But my waitress was nice and the food was really fresh and ready.  GET THE SHELL FISH IRON SKILLET!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Toshia E.

description: Beware steer clear of this place. I was unlucky on Christmas eve to have had lunch there. To my surprise I contracted food poisoning from their Cioppino. I spent half my evening in the emergency room trying to rehydrate. It ruined my Christmas. unfortunately it subtracted from the service ,the ambience and the killer view. Tillman desperately needs better leadership in the kitchen.
author: Rene C.

description:
The sizzling seafood platter was so amazing, we had two.  The initial sticker shock is immediately dissipated on the first bite ... what is that flavor?! Ambrosia?  So good!
Oh and the views from this place are gorgeous!
We definitely plan on coming back again.
Five stars for food, views and friendly staff.  Thanks, Chart House, for being nice to a couple of locals who stumbled upon an awesome experience.
author: Nancy S.

description: If you like to wait 30 minutes for a drink please continue to dine here. We waited 15 minutes at the bar for nothing then we got seated and waited 15 more minutes for watered down drinks. We spoke with the manager understood that it was short staffed but he could not explained why a different customer who came later to the bar and was served before us. I mean I'm not the most at attractive looking mofo but seriously? We paid for our drinks and walked out.  I don't think we will come here again. Btw the manager did offer a side  "salad and soup" as a chance to "fix" things. Lol thanks but no thanks fix your staff first.
author: Hean S.

description: Customer service was horrible! We were seated and no one came to our table to greet us, offer water, or even acknowledge us!  We sat for 13 minutes without anyone coming over to our table...even though numerous waiters walked by us several times. We decided to leave at that point. If you plan on eating or getting any type of service at all...do NOT come here!
author: Melanie W.

description:
I had thought this chain went out of business, but it still exists.  I really liked the old Chart House, too, so after spotting it, we decided to try it.

We were told a 35 minute wait, it was about that.  Not a problem.  

We waited in the bar.  The service was not very good there, and no one seemed to be bussing the tables.  We got drinks.  DIdn't get charged.  

We were escorted to our table.  The view was fabulous.  That was really nice.  The service was great, the food was really pretty good. 

I didn't have any of the problems people here are describing.  The only issue was at the bar, and I thought it might have been because it was mobbed.  

So all in all, worth a visit. For two of us, we got out for about $80.  That included appetizers, soup, and entrees.  Not unreasonable, but not cheap, either.  Given its location, it's about what you would expect.

As far as I'm concerned, it is an ok place to go to if you are there.  I would not make a special trip out of it, though.  It's a lot of trouble working through the crowds to get there.
author: Jon N.

description: I was curious as to why such a chain restaurant in a prime location would only get 2.5 stars. Wait for it. No, seriously, wait. I had a dinner reservation for 5:30pm. At 6:30 I was told it'd be "at least another hour." I was told to order from the bar and get something that was quick. Like soup. Not poke because that takes too long. Their words. The bartender said she had 10 drink orders ahead of my request. I left at 7pm to eat a pretzel from a corn dog stand. Never had the opportunity to try the food. Poor customer experience.
author: Myra S.

description: Rarely leave reviews. Was hoping to have a nice lunch at the bar. When people started getting up from their tables to remind the bartender about their drinks, I knew I made a wrong choice in coming here. Ordered a burger that took 25 minutes to come out. They were understaffed, so the sole bartender was busy with the rest of the restaurant. My $15 burger was overcooked, but the bartender never asked me how my meal was. To top it off, they only have a single bathroom, as their other one is under renovation, so I almost pissed my pants waiting in line. I ended up paying for my meal to get out of there, but informed the manager of how horrible the experience was. She offered to give me a free to go meal--which I passed on, considering I would've had to wait another half hour at least.
author: John P.

description: This was my first and most likely the only time I would come here. I made a reservation for 4 at 8pm. We didn't get seated until 8:45pm. After ordering our food we waited an hour just for the food to come out. One of my party ordered the lobster Mac & cheese and it tasted sour. The lobster was not fresh at all, it could have been bad at this point. We sent back the mac due to how bad it was. The restrooms were completely unclean. No paper towels or seat covers and the faucets were leaking all over the bathroom. This place is not cheap so I wouldn't waste my money. I'll stick to Ruth's Chris.
author: Rick R.

description: Odd place First it's in a very nasty tourist location ( I live in Chicago and would call it a low end navy pier) BUT the views are extraordinary GREAT service Great an overall good experience BUT no place to get Cioppino not spicy but overall a good time wife had the seafood salad that was ok make sure you get a window seat nice wine food loses
author: Barry B.

description: The restaurant itself was very nice. Amazing view of Alcatraz from pretty much any seat in the restaurant. Definitely order seafood if you're going to eat here. The portions are too small for the price you are paying. The waiter who helped us was kind of rude and a little condensing, seemed annoyed when you asked him questions. Only went in because the wait time for a table was short. There are so many other options in this area, I would skip this restaurant.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Great view but HORRIBLE service. Came here for Mother's Day and left quite disappointed. Our waitress went on a break and didn't mention anything to us. I had to go to the host stand and speak to a manager because our party of 5 was left stranded. We asked for hot sauce and bread/butter 4 times and never got the hot sauce, even after asking a manager. We ordered 4 soups and that took about 25 minutes after we had finished the appetizers. Not one person came over to refill our water. Then the entrees and soups came out at the same time. Horribly timed food service. After eating the soup, all of the entrees were cold and had to be sent back. Again, no one was around to offer water and check on how we like the entrees. 
The manager came over and apologized several times but this felt extremely disingenuous and forced. When you ruin a dining experience this badly, the management should compensate accordingly but of course we were let down once again! Too bad chart house, you lost 5 customers with many connections in the restaurant industry that will not be recommending your restaurant to anyone.
author: Ana D.

description: The views from this restaurant are awesome. The appetizers we had were good (crab tower) but the entrees were  awful. My wife had a piece of chicken that was supposed to be served with asparagus and mashed potatoes. The piece of shoe leather like chicken that was offered was served with green beans and no potatoes. They corrected the potatoes but ignored the fact they got the green beans wrong. My fish in chips were no better than a 3/10.  We spent over $100 for poor quality food and average service. We won't be going back view or no view.
author: Ian L.

description: Had a wonderful experience and meal! Calvin is awesome and watching the sunset over appetizers was amazing!!  The Seafood Cioppino was awesome!
author: Allison M.

description:
First of all - the view was incredible! We was sat by the window with views of Golden Gate bridge, the bay and Alcatraz! Was definitely the highlight.  The food was okay, my sister-in-law had the salmon which was DELICIOUS, I had the seafood pasta which was okay but nothing to write home about. Drinks were nice, I got a mojito and was okay. The waiter, who was from Serbia was lovely and polite, really enjoyed his company and the owner even came by our table and asked us about our meal which was a lovely touch and we really appreciated it. The reason I give the score so low was because of the hostess. WOW. She should really rethink her hosting abilities! The hostess was an African american girl, I should of got her name but she was very rude and hostile towards us. She had a BAD attitude and that's definitely one of the main reasons I will not be returning. Give her a talk to about her attitude!


UPDATE... After reading other reviews about the hostess, I seriously think you should look into this!
author: Charlotte M.

description: Food was ok.  Was expecting a little better quality for the price especially when you order a drink that's $14 and when you order another one it's in the exact same glass as the first one!  So disgusting!
author: S. N.

description: Food was ok but for the price wasn't worth it. The Windows on the side were not blocked by anything from the sun so the people who sat against the window during sunset were miserable and sad. Spent entire time concentrating on how to keep my face from burning and the only thing the waitress said and did was have a dumb look on her face. So $110 later and an unfortunate sun tan to the face area and the heat stroke I don't think I would try this location.
author: Art A.

description: Our party of eight sat in the bar area which was perfect for us. I was so wrong!!! This was the WORST FOOD SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD!!! They had a banquet going on so we were told we were not a priority. They forgot our soups, when we did receive them two minutes later they brought the main course. Food was cold, when asked to bring just fresh sides they reheated the whole entree and ruined a prime rib from rare to extremely well down, totally forgot to ring in one of our orders, and the manager was the one that took our order!!! The hostess who was trying to help was extremely rude!! Needless to say we were very disappointed with the whole experience. The MANAGER SHOULD BE ASHAMED, she wouldn't even comp us correctly for the HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!
author: Shawn Liz L.

description: Best views of the bay and Alcatraz. We ate lunch there, the food was good but a little pricey.
author: Mike R.

description: The view was amazing.  Good service.  Nice ambient.  Did was good.  Clam chowder was very yummy.
author: Keith N.

description: I usually don't write Yelp reviews, but this place needs some work. First, me and 2 other folks come in and ask to be seated on a Wednesday night, only to be told it's a 20 minute wait. It took longer than that to seat us, even though the restaurant was pretty empty. Unfortunately, our phones were dead so we couldn't look at the Yelp reviews before hand. The food took forever -- we were in the restaurant for about 2 hours and when it finally came the fish was under seasoned and dry and came with vegetables, sauce and salsa all over it that we didn't ask for. We ordered mahi fish, seasoned with lemon and the fish pasta which was passable, but not good enough for the prices here. At the bar, when I asked the bartender for a gin and tonic, she asked me what vodka I want with that... Are you kidding me??? When we asked for the check, that took another 20 minutes to get there, even though the place was mostly empty. The server and hostess were extremely nice and were very receptive to our comments, but overall I would not recommend coming here. They did comp us for the food we returned, but I would wait for them to establish themselves before coming back.
author: Kulmeher D.

description: Very disappointed! Took husband on a Monday for his birthday had reservations for a week for a good table ocean view they put us in a corner with lil view. Ordered bottle of wine the waiter spilled some on the table after he cut his finger and had to leave the table while opening the bottle. Spinach salad and oysters were good for appetizers however our main entree of prime rib and Maine lobster were in need of help! I sent my Raw fatty prime rib back and lobster was well a lobster. Lol I ate my husbands Brussels sprouts and drank the wine was not good or no good service for spending $200 for two people and that was after they took the $38 prime rib off! Don't waste the time more restaurants that are better!
author: Traci H.

description: Service is slow and unorganized. Food okay but not worth the price. Pass on this place. Go find better elsewhere. Took forever to get a water and coke. Took forever to get food. Just expected more. And it was a slow day.
author: Eliseo B.

description:
Great views, good food, honestly bad service--and we're really not that picky--but very bad service. Didn't sit us when they could've (and we'd had reservations for Over two weeks) didn't give us a window table when there were many open ones, brought us the wrong salads and didn't apologize or replace them, were incredibly slow--over 20 min to tell us one of their more reasonably priced wines just wasn't chilled enough--it goes on and on. 

If you live in SF, skip it! There's just too many nice restaurants to waste your $$ there!
author: Rebecca R.

description: Walked in and was told we would wait 10 minutes. After 20, I asked for an update and was told "our computers are down. It will be longer." Since we had been seated across from the hostess desk the entire time, it was puzzling why the hostess couldn't have told us this but perhaps it didn't enter her mind since she was busy talking to the bartender and the other hostess.
author: Pauline M.

description: Good food. Slightly pricey. Amazing view.  Service was wonderful.  Visiting San Francisco for a week and went here twice.
author: Steve D.

description: It should have been an indicator that the bar was empty, and there were plenty of tables available at 7:30 on a Saturday night.  We sat at the bar to decide about dinner.  Even though it was empty, it was10 min before someone took our order.  We decided against dinner, and it was another long wait to get our check.  My martini was perfect, but the poor service helped us decide to go elsewhere for dinner.
author: Dawgs W.

description: We had our wedding reception at this location in the private sea lion room. For us, SF is a deatination wedding as we live in LA. Stanley Howard handeled everything with ease and made sure the event flowed smoothly.
author: Mmj T.

description: This place has a beautiful view but the food is HORRIBLE!! I had the Seafood Cobb Salad, my husband had the Crab Melt, and my son had the Fish and Chips.  My salad cost $21 and had canned crab meat, no flavor, and was super small.  It said it came with Dungeness crab, it was the worse tasting Dungeness crab I have ever eaten.  This "Cobb" salad came with Thousand Island dressing.  Thousand Island dressing is typically for a "Louie" and a Cobb is typically served with blue cheese.  So my husband ordered the "Dungeness" Crab Melt, again don't know what crab they were using but he said it had no flavor and tasted like canned crab meat.  He figured it was a melt so it would be between two pieces of bread but it was open-faced, the menu never indicated that.  We paid $19.50 for a small open-faced sandwich with a huge plate of fries that were way over salted, and I love salt and they were too salty for me. No my son who is 15 ordered the Fish and Chips, he liked his fish and chips but my husband observed that they were frozen not fresh fish and chips. They were very symmetrical, indicating they were mass produced and frozen.  We paid $19 for his pre-frozen fish and chips that we could have made at home for $4.99.  We don't mind paying $100 plus for dining out but my God make it worth out money.  So my complaint doesn't end there.  The food took well over 30 mins, closer to 40mins to get and the service was mediocre at best.  These were complicated items that had a lot of cooking time and the place wasn't packed or super busy.  So disappointed.  I wished I had taken the time to take some picks. I am not one to complain but I felt the need to warn people.  Go somewhere else, there are plenty of places to go on Pier 39.  I wished I had read the reviews ahead of time.
author: Gretchen F.

description: We had an amazing time! The staff are so tentative! David was our waiter, great personality!The food was amazing! Timing of delivery between courses, perfect!
author: Richelle C.

description:
Valentine's Day, it seemed the restaurant was slow, no one standing in line like all the other restaurants on the pier. They tell us it's a 30 minute wait. Not bad! So we stay. We go sit at the bar, hoping to get something to drink until we get our table. It takes at least 20 minutes and we had to say something! The bar tenders are swamped with glasses and mess, all over the bar. The people next to us on the right, left due to no service, the people to our left, helped us out by getting a hold of one of the staff. We finally got our first drinks, and ordered an appetizer. We did decide to stay, and order food. The reason I gave 2 stars was because the food was good, and hot as well! But the poor staff was not qualified enough to be by them selves. Must've still been in training. Not enough staff to clean and wash dishes. Our neighboring couple never even got their bill after 30 minutes of waiting! They walked out without paying.  We did pay. But our bill was wrong, didn't charge me for the 2 beers I had. 
The management needs to be changed, it could be a great restaurant if the staff was trained and service was better.
author: Tina S.

description: Awesome raspberry lemon drop martini. Terrible service. We left after over an hour wait for a table and a rude manager lying to us about wait time estimate of 30 minutes. Meanwhile no less that 6 empty tables in our line of sight over the last hour! Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Tisa R.

description: Food was decent but service is so slow that we ended up cancelling our entrees and went somewhere else. This was on a Thursday night.
author: Chris C.

description: Only good for the view. Worst service. The workers are rude and clueless. Save your money and your time.
author: Kristina L.

description: Incredible food and service! The blood orange margaritas are the best around.  Incredible dinner and view!
author: Susan M.

description: Sat in the cocktail area by myself for dinner. Got a drink to start with and ordered an app. This was last time I would see server. After app came, mgr asked if I wanted entree so I got entree. When it came, I had to ask the food runner for silverware, more drink and napkins. No one had checked on me. 10 minutes later the food runner brought out a tray that the shells were supposed to go into and apologized that no server had done it. The mgr checked every table except me. I finished entree and sat there with dirty dishes (empty appetizer was still on table), a server actually finally came and picked up the menus but did not offer to clear plates, get check, refill water ---- nothing. So, I asked the food runner from the kitchen to get mgr and mgr was barely apologetic. I ended up directly tipping the food runner from the kitchen. Too many places near pier 39 for bad service.
author: Tim B.

description: Very busy for xmas, the hostess upfront was very dramatic about how chaotic her day had been, but the server was wonderful and really did his best. We got the prime rib which had great flavor but was cooked medium well despite asking for medium rare, this was disappointing. I got the mahi with crab and lobster topping, delicious! Tip: if you have AAA let them know you get 10 % off your food bill!
author: Alyssa W.

description: I specifically went there for fresh fish. Most of there fish was frozen or canned. Especially the clam had canned clams. I was very surprised and I was very disappointed. This was a restraint on Fishermans Wharf. There is no excuse they don't have fresh fish. Also it was very pricey and the food did not match the prices. I ordered something else besides fish.
author: Maria T.

description: Walked in at 830. Asked if they had a kids menu or if lunch menu would be available also. Kinda got a word look from hostess. I was there with my daughter. Who is 9. Maybe we didn't fit the profile for there clientele. Was told we have no more reservations. I said I wasn't looking for a reservation and that we were walk in. Told we don't have anything available for walk in. WTF. No walk ins. I guess the baseball hat and jeans were underdressed for her. Sorry I wear suit everyday to work. If I'm on vacation I dress down. Oh well. I feel bad for the waiters and staff because they missed out on there tips. I know they work hard so I take care of them.
author: Brian A.

description:
TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! SKIP THIS PLACE!

I made a reservation for a friend here and I'm not sure if their staff is fucking blind or they just did not double check their records, but my guests arrived and they were told there was no reservation made for them .They were very upset especially because they were coming from out of town and were only here in SF fr a short while. The lack of professionalism is irritating. I'm not sure if I spoke to the manager the next morning and she then told me that they made a mistake and that the reservation that I did make was there. She should have offered my guests a free dinner or something. She seemed pretty unapologetic. The customer service here is horrible!
author: Camille N.

description:
If i could i would give negative stars.  The location is prime, no question, but the rest is AWFUL.  We waited more than an hour to get our food. Poorly made cocktails. You would think that they could not mess a cesar salad. But they did! 
The manager ... Useless. 
Save your money for a place that has some pride in their work.
author: Eduardo M.

description: A Landry's chain so expect the food to be ok.  Service was good and the view of the Bay was nice. Ambiance is also nice and can be romantic if you're on a date.  We were seated promptly upon arrival and didn't experience any problems.  The food was ok, my fish tacos lacked some flavor and seasoning, but tasted fresh.  The highlight, since it was my birthday, was a huge slice of chocolate-mocha ice cream cake.  The staff was quite friendly and several of them, including the hostess, came over to wish me a happy birthday.  Wouldn't mind coming back again in the future.
author: William T.

description:
Went to dinner there last night with my husband and our daughter. I'm giving it 2 starts because although the food was good (a bit salty but still ok), the service wasn't. The issues were:
1. The server forgot to give us the lobster bisque. Had to ask the manager for it. 
2.  My husband asked for a cup of hot water at the end of our meal and didn't get any. 
3. We were going to order dessert but when we found out that the lava cake was going to take 30 minutes, we said no and just give us the check. The server said that he was going to check if they had an extra cake in the back that's ready and if they did, he asked if we wanted it. We said sure. He came back about 5 minutes later and said that they have one ready. He put a couple of forks and napkins for us and left. We assumed that he was getting it but after about 10 minutes, he reappeared at the table next to us and proceeded to get their orders. When he was done, my husband flagged him and told him that we don't think we have anymore time to wait for the lava cake and to just cancel it. He said "oh let me check on it" and was about to leave again. At this point I was really frustrated and firmly said "No, just forget about it and give us the check." I felt like he was trying to play us and buy time so we wouldn't notice that it's been almost the same time as it would have been if they didn't have an "extra" cake that's ready to go. 
4. I had our leftover boxed up together (seafood alfredo and a piece of fish from my daughter's fish and chips). When preparing her lunch for school, she took the box and was about to get her fish when she asked me "Mom, is this your food from last night? It looks different. Where's the fish?" Inside the box was a piece of bread and some kind of pasta with chicken and vegetables. THEY GAVE US SOMEONE ELSE'S LEFTOVERS!
author: Sherry L.

description: The management here is terrible very unorganized.  Was at the bar they only had one girl working on the busiest night I have seen. 5 stars to her she was a fireball trying to make everyone happy while her bar manager barking orders at her when she should of been helping instead.  This Resturant needs way better management and workers that respect their co workers. I give 1 star to the management and 5 stars to the young girl name Christy who is  quite a fireball and a fantastic hostess/waitress/bartender. Maybe she should run your Resturant cause she is fantastic and the only reason I even come to this place! Only giving 5 stars because of Christy! My husband and I will be back and will make sure to ask for Christy!
author: Debbie F.

description:
Dreadful food, poor quality control.  Cannot compare to other Landry brands.  And does not live up to any other Chart House.  They have no ability to recreate other Chart House dining experience.
Would not return.  Probably only good for tourists who are enchanted by the view.  Those of us that are locals really look for quality of product and this restaurant cannot "get there"!
author: Bailey G.

description: My boyfriend and I dined here tonight right on the water with an amazing view and our waiter was Johnny. He was such a cool guy with a great attitude! He talked me into ordering one of the better dishes and I ended up getting the blackened salmon with the Baja topper. It was my favorite dish I've had in a while, and my boyfriend loved his grilled mahi mahi with pineapple mango topper. We will definitely be coming back!  Thanks Johnny!! -Ken & Kayla
author: Kayla L.

description: Poor service. I asked how is the steak and the gal answered she was a vegetarian. Long waits with no one in restaurant. Owner needs to get off T.V. and back to his restaurant.
author: Brian H.

description:
Good service and excellent ambience over seeing the ocean. Good food and appetizers

10 minutes of wait before we were seen. We showed up without a reservation.
author: Aj C.

description: 5:15 reservation, asked to enjoy a drink before ordering.. She said, ok, not like it's 7ish when too busy..!! My first drink of Tanqueray and Tonic, could barely taste the gin.. Apparently, it cost a dollar more than  the $10 to get a good drink..Food was ok, not bad, but my Filet was at most 1/2 inch thick, normally a bit thicker..Wife's prime rib was good..We left at 7:20 and barely 1/2 full for Valentines Day..Mgmt stopped by twice and were nice.. Love Charthouse, but would not here.. Monterey or Tahoe..!!
author: Mickey M.

description: Great service the food was good. However, the Filet Mignon was a little over cooked and my coffee was half full with coffee grounds. Overall I would give this restaurant a 3, due to my experience.
author: Kenneth C.

description: Outstanding view, outstanding view, and excellent service. Always get the Clam Chowder, also the Mahi is delicious.
author: Robert V.

description: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!! This place ruined our New Years Eve dinner. I made a reservation for 12/31/16 a week in advance for 10:15pm I got a call to confirm the reservation 2 days before. When we got there I was told they were running 1 to 2 hrs behind schedule, all I got was a "sorry" no solution was given, they also promised I will get a text when my table was ready but I NEVER got a text. Definitely not going there ever again! Terrible management.
author: Sergio V.

description: we made a reservation through open table for our first wedding anniversary and learned from then on ALWAYS check out yelp reviews in addition! This location was beautiful but pretty much everything else about it was HORRIBLE! once we were seated we asked for water and it took 20 min for the waitress to come to us and we asked for water again, which came about 10 min. after that. The poor waitress seemed stress but was so young and did not have the best etiquette ( walked away from us or other tables before people were done talking). It took about 15 min. just to  get our drinks ( alcoholic) and we had ordered an app. at the same time which took about 30 min. to brig out ( lobster mac n cheese). The main course also took about 30-40 min. My husband ordered a swordfish which was delicious, I ordered prime rib medium rare and it came out PINK AND BLEEDING.  We ended up sending the prime rib back and canceled it because we didn't want to wait 40 more min,. for another meal! We definitely wont be surprised if this place closes with in the next year!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Thank you manager Lori and entire C.H. staff for allowing us to enjoy cocktails at Happy Hour prices in the Bar and a very deelich dinner...since you haven't even officially opened for Happy Hour yet! Also what a great new looking restaurant interior with the million dollar views whoohoo!!!  We are telling all our local SF peeps to drop on in to the new C.H. end of Pier 39.
We shared a menage of soups so good and chopped spinach salad WoW!!! My skinny fries with fish and chips the best ever. Good Luck at this new location.
author: Ron M.

description: I just want to say that I was SHOCKED at the service I received at the San Francisco location tonight. Took 25 minutes to get drinks and bread there were only 7 tables that had people at them. It was not even 10% full. They forgot one of our appetizers. Brought our desserts out at seperated times and by seperate times I mean my boyfriend has finish his before I got mine. The lava cake was luke warm. I waited an extra 15 minutes for a Luke warm lava cake? The only bathroom had throw up all over and was not able to be in use. Than when I got the manager over she was making excuses for as to why things are the way they are. It was my boyfriends birthday which I had told when I made the reservations and nothing was done of it. No candle or anything. We got a small.  $25 comp for the whole dinner being awful. The manager was rude to us because we were unhappy. The reason for the comp on the check was: upset. No the service was sub par and food was not hot and we had a 2 hour dinner for AWFUL service.
author: Marissa H.

description: These place is awesome! Great food and service! We hold our team breakfast there every month as well as joining them for lunch regularly.
author: lucia f.

description: Don't even bother. I should've read the reviews before going in. Food was expensive and tasteless. The view is worth 4 stars. Previous reviewers mentioned the unfriendly hostess. She started out a little cold but finally cracked a smile and warmed up nicely.
author: Valerie L.

description: Was just treated like a third rate citizen by your Asian host (with way too much glitter on her cheeks). Turned around and took my family to another restaurant. I guess you get enough ignorant tourists coming here that you don't need me. Good luck with that hostess. She will make sure you are never too crowded.
author: Raquel M.

description: Bad news bears. It took our server 10 minutes to even acknowledge us, that should have been when we got up and walked out but we were starving so we stayed. Maybe he was busy so give him some grace right? It just went downhill from there. Took longer to get our drinks and even longer to take our orders. "I'll be back in 2 minutes to take your order" turned into 10. 10 minutes waiting and then another 10 to take our order? The wait to get our bland entrees was ridiculous too (I don't hold the server responsible for the taste of the food but he never even checked back so I couldn't ask for extra dressing or more ketchup) Seriously the worst service I've had in years. The table behind us literally asked the manager what was taking the server so long. She said she'd try to get him back on track but it sure didn't happen while we were there. If the server is that bad, that reflects on poor management. If he's that busy help him out! or if he's that slow, let him go. The first time ever in my life that I've left $0 for a tip. Honestly that bad.
author: Shannon B.

description: The front of the restaurant looks classy, it has a beautiful view! But....the bartender has no idea how to make "craft cocktails"! My cucumber Collins was not very refreshing. Didn't taste like cucumber at all. My date ordered a Moscow mule and it was not good at all! Super sour! Not pleasant. To top it off they only have one bathroom for all the customers! As in just one toilet! The line was super long! Won't be going there again!
author: Jez G.

description: We had dinner at the CH in SF this past weekend. I really wasn't that impressed all things considered. Our food was just kinda ok and it seemed to take quite a while to get our food considering how empty the place was. The location is great and the view is quite nice.
author: Myles M.

description: After a long day of seeing the city, this was a great stop at sunset. Great view. Service was somewhat slow but waiter kept our glasses full as we waited. Would come again
author: Kristen F.

description: This is one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. We ate at the bar and had to continue to chase down bartenders to serve us because they were too busy watching the Olympics on TV.  After forgetting our requests for food several times the food finally came out. The Shrimp salad looked like it was using frozen shrimp out of a bag and the chicken sandwich was raw (uncooked) and we didn't realize until about the third bite. After bring this to the manager Farah's attention. She didn't even go out of her way to comp the bill properly. You would be better off eating at McDonald's. They deserve to go out of business.
author: Ashley P.

description: Just got done eating here. Even though I knew this was a 2 star my husband and I decided to make a reservation and try it out anyway, we came in with low expectation. Glad we did. Was seated and waited 15 minutes until our server came, he was nice but ultimately just mediocre service. My husband and I both ordered prime rib, mine came out well done although the chef flipped it over to show the pinker sides and my husband ordered medium rare, which came out medium. It wasn't until the end of the meal that the server advised us of how the meat is typically prepared, probably good in share that prior to having a customer order. Only good part was I didn't pay for my meal but other than that this place was pretty horrible. I do not recommend.
author: Amy R.

description: Just left the Chart House and had an amazing experience! All of the waiters and staff were very friendly and attentive. We celebrated my brother in law's wedding dinner there and they were able to accommodate approximately 25 of us with a reservation. The chicken, salmon, and mashed potatoes were delicious! To top it off we had our choices of dessert. I had the Mud Pie which ice cream on top of a cookie of some sort with fudge-amazing! I highly recommend this place!
author: Edwin G.

description: We walked in at 2 o'clock and was told we had a 20 minute wait, after about 35 minutes we were seated.  It took about 15 minutes for the waiter to get our drinks and another 10 minutes for them to be delivered.  We had to ask for a bread basket. My son's meal came out first and as he began eating found a very large dark thick curly hair in his french fries.  We have blond hair!  My meal hadn't even been served yet and he was 1/3 done eating!  The waiter asked if we wanted another plate.  My son was completely grossed out and told him "No thank you.." The manager came out to deliver our bill which they charged us for drinks and deleted my son's meal, as if he was doing as a favor.  Definitely will never return again!!!  Only good thing about this experience was the view.
author: DeAnna G.

description: Large party of 27 is obviously a challenge in getting drinks and providing table service, water etc, so certainly can understand a lack of attentiveness. What is totally unacceptable is the inability of the kitchen to cook a steak to proper temperature and deliver food hot, or at least warm. Steaks were over cooked or borderline raw. Mashed potatoes were room temperature and the Caesar salad was an absolute joke. Even the coffee was lukewarm. For this price point, this was without a doubt, the worst meal I have ever had. I would never return to this restaurant.
author: J S.

description: Food was great, atmosphere with the view is impeccable, our server Nick was state of the art and prices are reasonable for what you get. I had fillet mignon and even chef himself stop by our table to say hi! 5/5
author: Nash R.

description: This was the most uncomfortable dining experience I may have ever had. Service was absolutely terrible, we waited a significant amount of time to then get the "hey do you know what you want?" I should have followed my instinct and just left at this point but we stayed. He food arrived, I took one bite then realized there was hair cooked into the seasoning on my fish. The server quickly took it back to the kitchen and replaced the order as well as removed from check. Just a terrible experience. Enjoy a cocktail and take in the spectacular view.
author: Rachel L.

description: Only thing good about this place was the view.  Horrible service.  We couldn't even get water. The only good thing we ate was the bread our chowder came in. The clam chowder was horrible.
author: Jessica O.

description: Wasn't really impressed by the food here or service. Great ambience though.. I would check out other places by pier 39.
author: R M.

description: Walked in around 2:45, took 10 minutes for server to come back. Ok ordered a drink, 10 more minutes till drinks came out. Ordered a bowl of lobster bisque and the first appetizer on the menu. Never saw our server again. We tried to get her attention, but she was just to busy for us. She had 3 other tables get seated, they had appetizers and then there main course. Never asked us about another water or a drink. I believe it was at 3:30 a young gentleman who came into work asked us if he could help us. We asked him about our appetizer and soup, the woman who took our order quickly ran off towards the kitchen. It was too late for us. We paid for our drinks, the young man apologized and was very nice. We sat at a bar high top (table 2 I believe). Your service just sucked, wouldn't recommend to anyone and this woman isn't made for your industry. An apology can go a long ways, but she never came back.
author: Marty F.

description: Should be minus stars!! Made reservations 1 month ago.  Flew in from San Diego. Got here at 9:00 for a 9:15 reservation, was told they were running  45 min behind. . At 9:45 I was told they were just seating  8:30 reservations. We were in bar & we had no cocktail waitress , the bartender was doing it all. Which we had to go get him. We could not even get good in bar. He said they were under staff. And the kitchen was really running behind. We were told at 10:30 even if we got called & placed an order if would probably be another hour to get food. Unbelievable service  knowing this was going to be a special night. They seem to be oh well about the whole situation. We our Landry members & will not recommend  Chart House .again to anyone. Not sure how they stay in business. We had to go down street to Jonny Rockets for burgers & could only get to go food. They were at least  apologetic & pleasant to give a food before they closed. Unbelievable!! I had recommended the Chart House for my family  to go & was appalled & sad for what happened. Totally  disgusted with The Chart House !
author: Donna J.

description: Made online reservations and when we came in manager said it did come through and she didn't have are RSVP (I had received the confirmation via email) we decided to sit in bar area and proceeded to order drinks ( I like to drink) I saw my server enter drinks Into system and  saw her check 3 x S to see if our drinks were ready and they weren't (we were siting close to service well and could clearly see ) I use to dine a lot @ the  Hawaii /Rancho Mirage locations I remember when the Chart House was fine dinning.  I feel sorry for our server, she was very apologetic about all the unfortunate events that occurred. Management really needs to work on the bar service! U could clearly see they needed better Managment/Training this place needs a lot of work, we just expected a little more out of this visit especially due to such a great location!!Not to mention the person that came out dressed as a chief and was busing tables and spilled water on my wife's back !! My wife's main dish didn't show up till we were done and we were a party of 8. Disappointed and sad I'm a person who loves to eat and drink )-;
author: James G.

description: Great views, really nice inside, pretty good food, terribly slow service. It took us three hours to eat and we had a child with us too so didn't leave till 9:30, way too late. We sat for very long periods of time while our waiter was MIA. My good came back cool so maybe it was all sitting in back waiting for him to come off of break. We would have drank more and had a quicker, nicer meal of our waiter was around.
author: Melisa P.

description: made a reservation for dinner then I read a few yelp reviews and I pretty much decided to cancel but I decided to call the manager and voice my concerns.  the manager I spoke to (Amanda) immediately owned the bad reviews and took all the blame and assured me the problem with their reservation system had been ironed out.  long story short I went there for dinner last night and everything about the place is 5 star.  our waiter (joe) was great, the food was flawless.  my girlfriend had the prime rib and I had a bite and it literally melted in my mouth, beyond amazing.  before leaving I signed up for their version of a customer loyalty program.  as a san francisco native I stay away from fishermen's wharf and pier 39 in particular but this place is great and I of course will be going back.
author: Robert S.

description: This location used to be a great place to have a tasty bowl of clam chowder and watch the sea lions.  We came with a group and asked to have a seat overlooking the sea lions and the hostess told us she would "see what [she] could do".  After waiting for over 30 minutes, we were seated in the middle of the restaurant.  It turns out that all of the seating overlooking the sea lions is closed off and reserved for large, private groups only.  When we asked about the one open table near a window with a partial view, the hostess told us that a private party was in that area and we weren't allowed to sit there.  She said nobody can be seated in the area near the sea lions.  So, "seeing what she could do" was dishonest; she just waited until any table was available and probably figured we would be so hungry at that point we would stay anyway.  For how much it costs for mediocre food, the whole experience was a complete disappointment.  We will not be back.
author: Miki S.

description: Our servers name was David and he was amazing.  The food was delicious. I had the prime rib French dip and it melted in my mouth. I would suggest recommending him as your server because it seemed that others service was not as good as our.
author: Tara S.

description: OK, Landry's, listen up.  You've got problems with the Chart House on Pier 39  - we were there for a 7:30 dinner last Saturday night and the place was half full (at best).  Here's why:  1. We don't want to eat barbecue seafood New Orleans style when we are in San Francisco.  So cut out the Cajun seasonings on the Shellfish Iron Skillet. 2.  Get more servers!  Even with a half empty house, the servers seemed like they couldn't keep up.  Our water glasses were never refilled, rolls weren't ready but had to be baked (what?  Did you not expect people to be eating rolls that night?) 3.  Lemon juice is put in water to keep artichokes from turning color, not to add flavor or make them vinegary.  We couldn't taste any artichoke flavor in your steamed artichokes they were so lemony and sour.  Save yourself some money, cut back on the lemon juice and give the customers a better tasting artichoke. 4.  If you insist on using your "spice blend" in clam chowder, at least cut it way back so that the clams, potatoes and cream have a chance to shine.  Even better, cut it out. So do these things, tell people you have reworked your menu and hope you get a second chance.  The decor is lovely, the location can't be beat, but no one's coming back for the food.
author: Louise G.

description: I think probably one of the worst dining experiences I have had in awhile. The service should get negative stars if possible. I came on Yelp and realized the Chart House gets an overall 2 and 1/2 stars now it makes sense Iam not the only one who thinks this place is the worst. It is so unfortunate because as stated its prime location beautiful views , but it stops there. I believe his name was Billy our server was one of the most un personable servers I have ever come in contact with. No expression , interaction, anything whatsoever..very monotone voice. Like seriously ...I think he escaped from Alcatraz across the way and became the walking dead server at Chart House. I won't go into complete detail., although still in shock how a place like the Chart House could put their customers through such a dining experience. We were from out of town but had had good memories of the Chart House, because don't they have one in Dana point ,Ca.? My friend got married there and it was top notch. Any how enough rambling..manager took off one salad and gave us free dessert.. Big woopiie. I should have argued more but honestly did not want to ruin my vacation. Stay clear of here , wayyyyy too expensive for the lousy experience.
author: Amber R.
